title: Child Care Worker
description:
SCO Family of Services has provided vital human services throughout New York City and Long Island for more than 100 years. SCO helps vulnerable New Yorkers build a strong foundation for the future. We get young children off to a good start, launch youth into adulthood, stabilize and strengthen families and unlock potential for children and adults with special needs.

SCO Family of Services welcomes you to join our family and help us work together to carry out our mission to build a stronger tomorrow.

* Provide a safe, clean and caring living environment for program residents.
* Prepare meals according to weekly meal planner.
* Participate in activity programming including individual and group activities, sports, games, trips, enrichment activities, etc.
* Enforce the program’s daily routine by accurately completing reports, checklists & daily point sheets.
* Attention to and support of medical issues, student educational/vocational needs, case work, and clinical appoints.
* Appropriately confront negative behavior whenever it occurs.
* Maintain professional, positive and encouraging relationships with all residents, family members, and agency staff.

Qualifications

* Minimum of HS Diploma or GED required.
* This position requires successful completion of Therapeutic Crisis Intervention (TCI) training, which includes a written test and demonstration of the competency to perform physical restraints, as specified by the program and regulatory body. Additionally, staff must successfully complete all required TCI refreshers in order to maintain continued employment.
* Experience in child welfare is a plus.
* Must be able to provide excellent references.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

* Dental insurance

title: Litigation Paralegal - Adult Sexual Abuse
description:
**About Us**

Slater Slater Schulman LLP is a prominent full-service law firm with over 40 years of experience representing survivors of catastrophic and traumatic events. Our nationally renowned attorneys are committed to ensuring the best results for our clients through persistence and zealous representation. We have achieved successful resolutions in some of the most challenging cases in the industry, including 9/11 World Trade Center litigation, Child Victims Act, mass torts, pharmaceutical drug litigation, product liability litigation, environmental litigation, employment and labor law, medical malpractice, and personal injury.

**Position Overview**

We are seeking a Litigation Paralegal to work in our Adult Sexual Abuse Department in our NYC Office. Experience of 4+ years with negligence and personal injury cases needed. Must be reliable and professional to work as part of our close-knit team. A successful candidate should have excellent communication and writing skills; must be highly organized and detail oriented. Experience reviewing medical records is a plus. Hybrid work schedule offered to staff based on length of employment and measurable productivity.

**Responsibilities**

* Communicating with clients
* Preparing and exchanging discovery demands, responses and authorizations
* Obtaining and exchanging medical records
* Court filings
* Other administrative duties as needed

**Qualifications**

* Paralegal certificate preferred
* Litigation experience preferred

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

* Paid time off

title: Part Time Concierge
description:
**Job Overview:**The part-time concierge provides exceptional customer service. Meets and greets residents; checks guests and service providers in/out. Able to understand and react to emergency response and access control procedures; monitors and operates electronic security control systems; and accurately maintains daily logs, records and forms. Assists with general concierge services and performs administrative clerical, Word and Excel document work. Walks the building premises as directed for monitoring purposes.
**Your Responsibilities:*** Provides exceptional customer service.
* Meets and greets residents; checks guests and service providers in/out.
* Able to understand and react to emergency response and access control procedures; monitors and operates electronic security control systems; and accurately maintains daily logs, records and forms.
* Assists with general concierge services and performs administrative clerical, Word and Excel document work.
* Walks the building premises as directed for monitoring purposes
* Monitors and controls access to the building
* Resolves and follows-up on all complaints/issues, escalating to supervisor if necessary
* Provides general concierge services as well as administrative clerical work when needed
* Helps maintain a safe and secure environment throughout the building/property(s)
* Walks the building premises as directed for monitoring purposes
* Have the ability to understand and complete all required forms
* May be assigned other duties by supervisor

**Skills & Qualifications:*** Ability to manage multiple priorities
* Demonstrates excellent customer service, communication and time management skills.
* Basic knowledge of Microsoft Applications, especially Outlook, Word and Excel.
* Command of information system hardware/software is preferred
* Good written and verbal communication skills
* Strong customer service and interpersonal skills required
* Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
* Computer and peripherals, standard and customized software applications and tools, and usual office equipment.
* Ability to quickly and easily navigate the property/building as required to meet the job functions
* Ability to lift 30 – 50 lbs
* Requires standing, sitting position for long periods of time, walking and occasional climbing when necessary
* Handle, finger, grasp and lift objects and packages; must be able to reach with hands and arms
* The employee is required to work at a personal computer for extended periods of time as well as talking on the phone for extended periods of time
* Must have the ability to detect auditory and/or visual emergency alarms
* Occasional overtime may be required
* Must have the ability to work extended/flexible hours, weekends, and attend Board meetings.

title: Automotive Service Advisor
description:
**About us**

We are a family owned and operated for 50 plus years, multi-franchise full service automotive dealership in Pleasantville, NY.

Our work environment includes:

* Growth opportunities
* On-the-job training
* Business casual work attire

Job Summary:

Prestige Imports is seeking a highly motivated, dependable, reliable individual to join our talented, well established team. We are seeking someone to grow with our expanding business. Serious applicants only please. Excellent opportunity for someone who excels at customer service.

We are seeking Service Advisors who can exhibit the utmost level of professionalism and provide a truly exceptional experience to our retailer's customers. Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, greeting customers, performing a walk-around, parking customers' cars, answering phone calls, creating vehicle records, making appointments, writing up clear and concise repair orders, communicating clearly with our technicians, following the repair order from write-up to cashiering, checking in/out loaner cars, and follow-up. The ideal candidate will be able to work independently and as part of our team, communicate well with our customers and technicians, and provide exceptional customer service. Must have a **positive** attitude. Must be able to work assigned schedule reliably and consistently. Must provide verifiable references. Multiple training options including web-based and instructor led are available and necessary. Our work week is Monday through Friday from 8AM to 5:30PM and Saturdays when needed. We are conveniently located near several major Westchester county parkways with easy on/off access and are one block from Metro North's Harlem line train station. We are walking distance to several great dining options and outdoor spaces, great way to spend a lunch break. We look forward to hearing from you.

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**

* Writing up repair orders and following them throughout the course of the day
* Answering internet inquiries to facilitate appointments into the dealership
* Making phone calls to customers after a service department visit to find out about their experience
* Offering customers products and services via phone, email, text
* Maintain up-to-date knowledge of all vehicles, accessories, and promotions
* Develop and maintain relationships with customers, providing them with personalized service
* Conduct calls to schedule service and/or recalls and keep a log of calls placed.
* Collaborate with our management team on a daily basis
* Provide ongoing support and customer service to customers, addressing any concerns or issues that may arise
* Stay up-to-date with product knowledge and all training requirements

**Requirements:**

* Basic phone & computer skills
* Must have a clear, articulate and pleasant speaking voice.
* Ability to address and answer customer requests via phone, text and e-mail in a professional, friendly and efficient manner.
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to effectively multi-task.
* Excellent written and oral bi-lingual communication skills a plus.
* Excellent follow-up skills.
* Dependable and compliant in following assigned work schedule.
* Must be dependable and be able to report to work on time every day.
* Must be able to clearly communicate with management.
* Proven experience in customer service, preferably in a dealership or retail environment.
* Strong knowledge of computer software including, but not limited to, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, Microsoft Outlook, CDK, CRM
* Excellent telephone and email skills
* Demonstrate ability to deliver exceptional customer service and work in a team environment

If you are a results-driven individual with a passion for helping businesses succeed, we would love to hear from you. We are looking for someone that is interested in growing with our team, who have decades of tenure between them. Join our team as a Service Advisor and make a significant impact on our customer experience.

title: Payroll Specialist
description:
**HIRING IMMEDIATELY**

This position is a full-time in-office position from 9 AM - 5 PM, Monday - Friday.  
We provide training but a 2-year commitment is required.

**Job Description:**

The Payroll Specialist is primarily responsible for the accurate and timely processing of all payroll functions. The Payroll Specialist is the primary contact for all payroll inquiries and requires exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving skills. The successful candidate will and respond to frequent and urgent requests for information about payroll, tax, vacation and sick time, report generation, general ledger, and other general payroll policy matters.

**Responsibilities:**

* Checking timesheets for accuracy
* Entering data into databases and spreadsheets
* Handling direct deposit requests and data
* Processing paper checks for distribution
* Acquiring all necessary signatures to distribute payroll
* Processing wage garnishments
* Making adjustments in pay for raises, bonuses and commission
* Processes out of cycle checks and employee separations.
* Serve as a point of contact for employees inquiries regarding paychecks, direct deposit and/or general payroll questions.
* Maintaining current employee salary allocations per payroll.
* Troubleshoot problems with paychecks, tax deductions, vacation and sick accruals, and other payroll-related matters by researching and respond accordingly with related staff and managers.
* Runs and prepares reports on a regular basis for payroll.
* Demonstrated ability to process new hires, terminations, status changes, tax changes, deductions, calculating wage and overtime payments, double time and other duties associated with standard payroll processing.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 1 year expreince in excel
* Excellent attention to detail
* Exceptional mathematical and calculation skills
* Verbal and written communication
* Ability to work with a team

title: Daycare Teachers & Assistant Teachers
description:
Looking to make your best career match ever? **Fall into a new career**! Join the KinderCare Learning Companies!

**We are currently hiring for the following positions:**

* Full-Time Toddler teacher
* Full-Time Preschool Teacher
* Part-time Afternoon Teacher

At KinderCare, we offer a safe and positive learning environment with an outstanding curriculum to ensure that you can focus on what really matters - making a difference in the lives of the children in our centers. And the perks? Let's just say they're worth swiping right for:

* Warm and welcoming company culture
* **TONS of professional development and training from Day 1 to 100 and beyond**
* Substantial salary increases after 1st year
* Voted as a Gallup BEST place to work 8 years in a row

But that's not all - we've got some seriously sweet benefits to offer too:

* **Pet insurance**
* Medical, Dental, and Vision (after 30 days of employment)
* **Discounted childcare (Bring your child to work)**
* Education perks – Earn your CDA for FREE or grow your career with our tuition reimbursement

* Bi-weekly pay with direct deposit and Pay Active (early access to pay) options

What do we require from you?

* A love for children and an ability to establish meaningful relationships
* High School Diploma or Equivalent (minimum)

So why not say yes to applying with KinderCare? We're all about encouraging a love of learning in children and unlocking their full potential - and we need dynamic and hardworking people like you to help us make it happen.

Don't wait, match with a career you'll actually love. We're an equal opportunity employer, so everyone's welcome to join the party!

\\*Our highest priority has always been to keep our employees, children, families, and communities as safe and healthy as possible. In addition to our proactive partnership with WELL Building Institute, we are also subject to state law, local ordinances, and Health Department requirements for employees working in child care, school facilities, and corporate work spaces.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law.

title: Client Coordinator - Queens Village
description:
WellLife Network is seeking a dedicated Client Coordinator to join the team at our mental health facility in Queens village. The ideal candidate will provide exceptional direct support care to our residents while playing a crucial role in maintaining their medical records.  

**Some Essential Task:*** Must fulfill all the requirements of the Direct Support Professional role including, but not limited to, working at developing independent living skills, administering medications, promoting opportunities for choice, participating in recreation activities, and any other tasks required to ensure the safety and well-being of the consumers.
* Will track all medical appointments and follow-up appointments
* Ensure that medication inventories are completed and order new medication as prescribed, in a timely manner.
* Identify medication errors and communicate the errors to the nurse and manager effectively
* Will perform any other duties as assigned by a supervisor.

  

**Education and Experience Requirements*** NYS valid and clean Driver license
* HS Diploma or GED
* 1 year of HHA, CNA experience a plus
* 2 years of Direct Support Professional experience a plus
* Nursing student preferred

  

  

  

**About WellLife Network:**  

  

ABOUT US: Since 1980, WellLife Network, has been meeting the growing challenges of individuals with intellectual/developmental disabilities and mental illness. Our multidisciplinary approach and centralized referral process help to ensure that each person we serve receives the appropriate range of services and level of care, with an individual treatment plan, coordinated by highly competent and supportive case management professionals. In its early years, WellLife Network operated and maintained community residential facilities for people with developmental disabilities and mental illness, and provided programs of care, service, habilitation, rehabilitation, and social and recreational activities, in a home-like environment. Partnerships Make It Happen For almost four decades, WellLife Network has changed, evolved, and expanded, while remaining true to its mission of meeting the diverse needs of New York communities, businesses, and society and assisting those we serve to achieve greater personal and economic independence. WellLife Network has a long and valued tradition of working in partnership with the government, the business community, private philanthropy, and our colleagues in the nonprofit sector to offer proactive responses to society’s social and economic challenges. Since its founding, the WellLife Network culture has been marked by program growth and organizational development. A Network of Services - A Culture of Caring and Best Practices Today, with an annual operating budget of $100 million, a workforce of 1,800 staff, interns, and volunteers, and an affiliate subsidiary company, WellLife Network delivers critical services in the areas of behavioral health, intellectual/developmental disabilities, housing, co-occurring substance abuse behaviors, family support, vocational training, and care management. These services meet the pressing needs of more than 25,000 individuals and families annually, some 2,000 New Yorkers every single day. A culture of caring, best practices models, a spirit of innovation, and a commitment to measuring results and producing high returns on investment drive our work. A key element to our successful growth is our focus on technology, financial viability, and quality assurance – critical infrastructure supports that enable WellLife Network to deliver services with cost-efficiency, effectiveness, transparency, and accountability in a manner that mirrors the standards of high-performing business enterprises.

title: Membership Sales Assistant General Manager
description:
An Assistant General Manager (AGM) is a leader among our professional Membership Sales Team. As a central part of our team, the AGM at Jersey Strong is responsible for promoting and enrolling members into our new member and upgrade programs.  

  

This position is ideal for individuals who possess a passion for sales and prospecting, as well as an enthusiasm for helping people get started with membership and Personal Training. The AGM is a dynamic fitness professional who is comfortable with both selling and prospecting.  

  

To be exceptional, a strong understanding of fitness and sales is a must, as is a keen understanding of prospecting methods and an outgoing personality.  

  

At Jersey Strong, we are RESULTS FOCUSED, EMPATHETIC, and ENTHUSIASTIC. We focus on specific and measurable results and hustle to meet our goals. We are sensitive to the challenges of each person's unique journey and enthusiastic about the positive role fitness plays in people's lives.  

  

We offer paid continuing education, career development opportunities, and a complimentary membership for an immediate family member immediately upon employment. We also offer paid vacations and a matching 401K plan after just one year of employment.  

  

Jersey Strong is looking to develop the top fitness professionals in New Jersey and make fitness a career you can be proud of.  

  

**Requirements**  

Full-time availability (40 hours per week)  

Must be a goal achiever who understands how to develop, set, and achieve personal goals  

Must be an advocate of fitness and exercise  

Must be able to follow directions  

Must have a strong knowledge of sales  

Must be a strong verbal communicator  

Must have experience working within a team environment  

  

**Personal Profile**  

Professional in appearance, manner, and work ethic  

Takes ownership of responsibilities and feedback on performance  

Enjoys multi-tasking, adapting to changing situations, and accomplishing performance goals  

Honest, friendly, fun, disciplined, and enjoys regular exercise  

Consistently cultivates personal and professional development  

Believes in the transformative power of fitness  

Comfortable working with diverse groups of people  

Possesses exceptional communication and interpersonal skills  

Understands the importance of building strong relationships with clients  

Excited to help others achieve their fitness goals  

Passionate about providing outstanding customer service  

Embraces challenges and strives to learn and grow from them.

title: Grant Writer
description:
**GRANT WRITER - MORRISTOWN, NJ**

**COMPANY OVERVIEW:**

Millennium Strategies is a team of grant writing consultants working with municipalities and counties to apply for funding from various government and philanthropic sources. Founded in 2005, Millennium is the largest full-service grant consulting firm in the region. We currently represent over 110 communities in New Jersey, New York, and Pennsylvania. Over the past 18years, Millennium has secured over $900 million in grant funding for our clients.

**MAIN FUNCTION:**

Grant Writers at Millennium work with clients, ranging from primarily residential suburban communities to county governments to cities with complex infrastructure, land use, and public safety challenges. This work requires an acute attention to detail, the ability to juggle multiple projects with different deadlines, and the ability to work collaboratively with public and elected officials including, but not limited to mayors, administrators, clerks, council members, police and fire chiefs, recreation and health directors, and various other individuals with a role in local government. This position will report to the Director of Client Services. This role is required to report to our Morristown office, 2 days a week and work from home 3 days a week.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

· BS/BA in Political Science, English, History, Communications or an equivalent field

· Strong project management skills

· Knowledge of (or interest in) government or philanthropic funding programs

· Passionate about and confident in their writing ability

· Critical and analytical thinkers

· Experience meeting deadlines and/or working in a fast-paced environment that requires high levels of organization

· Prior experience providing customer or client service

· High attention to detail and organization

· Outstanding knowledge of MS Office

· Excellent communication and people skills

· Aptitude in problem solving

· Able to work independently but also be able to work as a team with a result driven approach

**KEY RELATIONSHIPS:**

· Millennium Staff

· Millennium Clients

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

· Working with the Director of Client Services to serve assigned clients

· Serving as the grant writer for assigned clients

· Coordinating the preparation of funding proposals, including:

* Reviewing guidelines to ensure thoroughness and completeness of each proposal. Outreach to local government and community stakeholders - Organization of supporting documentation (i.e., resolutions, letters of support, engineering plans, maps, cost estimates, financial records, etc.). Preparation of grant narratives in full compliance with funding guidelines. Submission, tracking, and follow-up of pending funding requests.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Paid time off
* Parental leave

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

While working at DialAmerica, you'll be able to refine the skills you already have and add some new ones that you can apply to your growth with us and any career you may pursue in the future. title: Graphic Designer
description:
**About Us:**

At the Pilecki Institute USA, we are a research institute, digital archive, historical museum, and educational institution all in one. Our mission is to preserve and explore the historical experiences of Polish citizens, documenting their stories and sharing them through immersive exhibitions, engaging educational programs, online resources, publications, and a variety of events. We are dedicated to keeping this important history alive for future generations.

We’re gearing up to make our mark in New York over the next 12 months! As we prepare for our big debut, we’re also working on building a strong online presence to connect with our future audience. This is an exciting chance to say “Hello, New York!” and start forming meaningful partnerships with local museums and institutions. We can’t wait to become part of the city’s vibrant cultural and academic community!

Graphic Designer:

We are seeking a talented and creative Graphic Designer to join our dynamic team. As a Graphic Designer, you will be responsible for translating our brand and marketing objectives into compelling visual designs. The ideal candidate possesses a keen eye for detail, a passion for design trends, and the ability to create visually stunning and effective assets across various platforms. This is a hybrid full-time position. This role is expected to come to our space a few times a week as needed.

Responsibilities:

1. Design Creation:

- Develop visually appealing designs that align with brand guidelines and marketing objectives.

- Create a wide range of assets, including but not limited to social media graphics, website elements, print materials, and promotional items.

- Bring fresh, creative ideas to the table, offering fun and innovative design concepts that we may not have considered.

- Transform archival materials into modern, engaging videos for social media, breathing new life into historical content.

2. Conceptualization and Ideation:

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and objectives.

- Contribute design ideas and concepts across various platforms, including social media, our website, and physical spaces, identifying key visual elements and features that can enhance brand presence and engagement.

- Participate in brainstorming sessions to contribute creative ideas and concepts.

3. Brand Consistency:

- Ensure consistency in visual elements across all platforms and campaigns.

- Uphold brand standards and guidelines in all design work.

4. Project Management:

- Manage multiple design projects simultaneously, adhering to deadlines and delivering high-quality work.

- Coordinate with team members, clients, and stakeholders to gather feedback and incorporate revisions.

5. Software Proficiency:

- Utilize industry-standard design software (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite) to create and edit visual assets.

- Stay updated on the latest design tools and technologies.

6. Collaboration:

- Work closely with the US marketing team and international teams to ensure cohesive and integrated design solutions.

- Maintain clear and reliable communication, proactively addressing any uncertainties or seeking clarification when needed to ensure smooth collaboration.

- Provide creative input and feedback during team discussions.

Qualifications:

- Bachelor’s degree in graphic design, Visual Arts, or a related field.

- 2+ years of experience in Graphic Design

- Experience in 3-D/ animation is preferred, but not required

- Experience in exhibition design is preferred, but not required

- Proficiency in design software such as Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesign.

- Creative thinking and the ability to translate ideas into visually appealing designs.

- Strong attention to detail and a passion for staying updated on design trends.

- Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with team members and clients.

- Time management skills and the ability to meet tight deadlines.

Please provide a portfolio and resume.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10006 (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10006

title: Home Infusion Registered Nurse - Per diem
description:
**Jesdit Infusion LLC Updated Job Description**

Jesdit Infusion is a fast-growing company that is seeking highly skilled and compassionate nurses throughout the New Jersey area. The primary role of a home infusion nurse is to provide clinical care, education, and excellent customer service to patients in their private residence and ambulatory infusions sites, where available. All infusion therapies, medications and medical supplies are provided by pharmacies and authorized by the patient’s doctor. As an in-home infusion nurse, not only will you be treating the patient, you will also have to work collaboratively with pharmacies and doctors to provide the highest quality care for your patients. This position does require traveling to patient homes, and an ideal candidate will be able to travel at least 40-45 minutes from their home to visit their patients for the duration of their treatment and be comfortable in diverse home settings.

Requirements:

* Current, unrestricted RN license for the state of New Jersey
* BLS/ACLS certification
* Valid driver’s license and auto insurance
* Clean background check
* In-depth knowledge of HIPPA policies and procedures
* Personal Liability Insurance
* Reliable personal transportation.
* Must have excellent IV skills (CRNI preferred)
* Competent at PICC line maintenance, port access/de-access Midline and PIV placement
* Minimum of 2 years of infusion experience. An ideal candidate will have experience with IVIG, SCIG, TPN, Remicade, Gammunex, Gammaguard, Entyvio and antibiotics such as Vancomycin Daptomycin etc.
* Bachelors degree in Nursing is preferred
* In-depth understanding of regulatory compliance with state and federal regulators
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to interact with all patients and their families in a compassionate and professional manner
* Pediatric care competency highly preferred but not required

Duties

Job duties vary by patient, medication, and doctor orders. All patients, unless specified otherwise, are to be seen on a weekly or monthly basis. While not an exhaustive list, duties include:

* Picc line dressing changes
* Port accessing/de-accessing.
* Lab draws,
* Patient assessment and teaching
* Troubleshoot equipment issues with patient (ad hoc basis)
* Milrinone hookups and bag changes
* Chemo disconnects (home setting or hospital setting)
* Infusing medication such as IVIG, SCIG, antibiotics, Remicade, Stelara, Solumedrol, Entyvio, Orencia, IV hydration and TPN
* Starting a PIV line and drawing blood for lab work and for infusions
* Deliver blood specimens to Labcorp or another lab facility (ad hoc basis)
* Fill out and submit all paperwork in a timely manner per company policy.

Schedule

Due to the nature of this position, the ability to work weekdays, weekends, days and nights are required. Must have a flexible schedule to devote at least 1 day a week to taking care of a minimum of 3 weekly cases.

Pay Rate

Regular Visit: Flat rate of $80.00 (includes initial assessment, medication education, medication administration, weekly bloodwork, weekly picc line dressing changes, port access/de-access, and chemo disconnect.

Hourly Rate: $50.00 an hour.

Per diem'

title: Postdoctoral Fellow - Gholami Lab
description:
**Position Description**

A position is available for a postdoctoral researcher with a strong background in cancer biology and immunology. This postdoctoral fellow will work under the direction of Dr. Gholami, an Associate Professor and surgeon-scientist at Northwell Health and Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory, within the laboratory of Dr. Westcott. The Gholami laboratory research is centered on understanding the host-immune cell interactions and the mechanisms by which the immune system and tumor microenvironment play a role in the biology and anti-tumor response of liver metastases. More specifically, the laboratory research focuses on mechanisms of immune resistance in liver metastases to develop novel immune augmenting therapies and practice-changing clinical trials.

Our group studies the interaction of the immune system and CRC, specifically in the context of liver metastases. CRC remains the second leading cause of cancer death in the United States, with the liver being the most common site of metastases. However, the liver constitutes an immunosuppressive microenvironment which is poorly understood. Communications between the different components of the tumor microenvironment influence tumor growth, its response to therapy, and its ability to metastasize. The Gholami laboratory investigates the importance of various immune cells using mouse models of CRC developed by Dr. Westcott (Nature Cancer, 2021) and clinical specimens, incorporating cutting-edge techniques in multiomics and spatial biology. These techniques allow us to observe the behaviors and interactions between cancer cells and immune cells at a single cell resolution. Our ultimate goal is to develop and test new immunotherapy treatment strategies, characterize interactions between tumor and immune microenvironment, and elucidate mechanisms of response/resistance to therapies.

Dr. Gholami has a vested interest in clinical trials and serve as the co-Chair of the Colon subcommittee for SWOG, a member of the NCI Colon Cancer Task Force and ASCO Guideline Expert Panel. We are looking for candidates interested in developing their own research question in alignment with the goals of the research laboratory. The selected candidate will be provided significant resources, including access to state-of-the-art laboratory space and the opportunity to discuss science in a multi-disciplinary and diverse atmosphere. Opportunities to learn about model systems of disease, advanced microscopy and sequencing, translational science, and clinical trials will be provided.

**Position Requirements**

Education: The applicant is expected to be in the process of completing or have recently completed a PhD degree with research experience in cancer biology and/or immunology.

Experience/Skills: The candidate must have a deep understanding of the requirement to test hypotheses experimentally to advance science. A track record of peer reviewed lead authorship publications is expected. Familiarity with animal and in vitro cancer biology models as well immunology is expected. completed a PhD degree with research experience in cancer biology and/or immunology.

For immediate consideration, you are invited to complete the application found here: Postdoctoral Fellow- Gholami Lab Position ID 241

For any additional questions, feel free to contact: sgholami@northwell.edu

**Supplemental Information**

**Compensation and Benefits**

Our employees are compensated in many ways for their contributions to our mission, including competitive pay, exceptional health benefits, retirement plans, paid time off, and a range of recognition and wellness programs. Visit our CSHL **Benefits** , **Postdoctoral Landing** & Postdoctoral Fellow Stipend Schedule (Download PDF reader) sites to learn more.

**Environment**  
Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory is a world-renowned biomedical research institution in New York. It has shaped contemporary biomedical research and is the home of eight Nobel Prize laureates. Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory provides a highly dynamic and interactive research environment and a unique opportunity of timely exposure to advances in various biomedical research fields and of interaction with a broad range of researchers from all over the world through its renowned Meetings and Courses program. We believe that science is for everyone. We have had researchers with a variety of backgrounds and believe in the importance of diversity, equity, and inclusion.

We strongly recommend to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 however; it is not a requirement for employment.  
CSHL is an EO/AA Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or protected veteran status. VEVERRA

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $72,800.00 per year

Ability to Commute:

* Cold Spring Harbor, NY 11724 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Cold Spring Harbor, NY 11724: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Registered Nurse
description:
**Per Diem RN - Clinical Trials (performed in-home)**

*Calling all Infusion, Emergency, and Clinical Research Registered Nurses!! Are you looking to expand your skillset? Would you like to help to bring life changing medicines to patients faster? Are you looking for a flexible opportunity to enhance your monthly income?* 

MRN is passionate about ensuring that everyone has access to clinical trials, no matter who, or where they are in the world. We are driven by a desire to accelerate the drug development process and by bringing new medicines to the general population quicker. We achieve our vision by conducting clinical trials directly in patient communities, reducing geographical, logistical, and socioeconomic barriers.

We partner with healthcare professionals across the globe to administer study drugs successfully and safely, collect safety bloods and perform other clinical activities as needed.

This is an excellent opportunity for experienced and highly motivated registered nurses to join a unique organization and positively impact patients’ quality of life. Additionally, you will be working on **ground-breaking clinical trials**!

**We are currently recruiting per-diem/PRN** **registered** **nurses** across the US with at least **two years’ experience** within **adult and pediatric** nursing who can demonstrate the following:

* IV insertion and phlebotomy skills
* Infusion skills (Mandatory)
* Experience in using Central Venous Access Devices (Highly Desirable)
* Knowledge of providing nursing in the home or community environment is beneficial but not required
* An enthusiastic, positive attitude with great attention to detail is required
* Great organizational skills and ability to plan visit activities independently is required
* Experience as a Clinical Research nurse is highly desirable but not required

**Please note,** you will be required to travel so a current **driving licence and access to a vehicle is essential.**

**In return we can offer you:**

* Excellent rates of pay
* Flexible working hours/shift patterns
* Paid travel and mileage reimbursement
* Training and continuing education
* Unique and varied clinical experiences, that will enhance your clinical skills
* The opportunity to take an active role in clinical trial development and drug deployment
* Provide life changing medicines to patients who may not otherwise have had access
* Referral Program

**Learn more about the company, our mission as well as see employee testimonies via our MRN website:** Medical Research Network | Patient Centric Clinical Trials | MRN (themrn.io)

**You may also learn more about our home trial support service via our MRN YouTube channel:**

*https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kqtyS6tfiU0*

Job Types: Part-time, Travel nursing, PRN, Per diem

Pay: $45.00 - $50.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Referral program

Medical Specialty:

* Home Health

Application Question(s):

* When did you perform your most recent IV insertion?

Experience:

* Nursing: 2 years (Required)
* Cannulation and phlebotomy: 2 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* BLS Certification (Required)
* RN License (Required)

Work Location: On the road

title: Director of People & Resources
description:
**SRLP Seeks Director of People & Resources**

**Our Mission**

The Sylvia Rivera Law Project (SRLP) works to guarantee that all people are free to self-determine their gender identity and expression, regardless of income or race, and without facing harassment, discrimination, or violence. SRLP is a collective organization founded on the understanding that gender self-determination is inextricably intertwined with racial, social and economic justice. Therefore, we seek to increase the political voice and visibility of low-income people of color who are transgender, intersex, or gender non-conforming. SRLP works to improve access to respectful and affirming social, health, and legal services for our communities. We believe that in order to create meaningful political participation and leadership, we must have access to basic means of survival and safety from violence.

**Director of People & Resources**

The Director of People & Resources will work to ensure SRLP Staff and Collective have the resources and support they need to achieve the organization’s mission. The Director coordinates recruitment and hiring processes, benefits enrollment and administration, and oversees evaluation processes across the organization with an eye for staff professional growth. This position directs the provision of Human Resources services, policies, and programs for SRLP. The Director of People & Resources is part of the SRLP Collective, the leadership body of the organization, and participates in all decision making processes, staff meetings, retreats, and shared organizational responsibilities.

**Primary Duties and Responsibilities**

* Manage human resources systems and work with all staff to ensure efficient, accurate, timely, and compliant administration.
* Lead the recruitment, hiring, orientation, and offboarding of staff, consultants and Collective members.
* Design a comprehensive onboarding and offboarding process for staff, consultants, and Collective members to ensure that individuals and SRLP have the necessary resources for success.
* Administer and process benefits.
* Tracking timesheets and accruals.
* Manage regular Collective Member supervision and evaluations.
* Work with the Collective to coordinate conflict mediation processes, transformative justice policies, such as anti-oppression trainings.
* Coordinate company-wide learning opportunities, such as sexual harassment trainings.
* Create professional development pathways and recommendations that enhance the staff and Collective experience.
* Ensure legal compliance, reporting, and practices are in place and remain current in local, state, and federal laws.
* Manage all labor and employment compliance issues, working closely with outside legal counsel as necessary.
* Help ensure a healthy, supportive, and sustainable work environment by updating organizational policies that adheres to SRLP’s values.

**Areas of Shared Responsibility and Staff Coordination**

* Participate in the Collective Development Team’s work, including:
* Organizing board meetings and annual collective retreats.
* Improving and maintaining our infrastructure and capacity for work to continue in a sustainable and non-hierarchical way.
* Increase the participation, decision-making, and leadership of low-income trans people and trans people of color in organizational governance.
* Contribute to short- and long-term organizational planning and strategy.
* Participate in Collective-wide responsibilities including attending monthly meetings, annual retreats, co-supervision, and team meetings.
* Coordinate staff and collective training to increase skills and address growth areas.
* Coordinate development and communication of emergency and safety planning protocols.
* Coordinate office cleaning (shared responsibility among all staff).

**Skills and Qualifications:** 

* 5 years experience in the small non-profit sector.
* Experience with building and managing human resource processes and policies.
* Experience with health expense reimbursement for gender affirming and inclusive care.
* Excellent interpersonal communication and organizational development skills.
* Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and respond quickly to new opportunities.
* Proficiency in tools such as Microsoft Excel and JustWorks.
* Proficiency with insurance platforms for benefits administration.
* Attention to detail and strong ability to work independently.
* Commitment to gender self-determination centered in racial and economic justice.
* Ability to work in a non-hierarchical collective organization.

**Hours and Compensation:** 

This position is a full-time, salaried position with medical, dental and optical benefits as well as three weeks paid vacation. SRLP works in a hybrid working environment. 40 hours/week, some evenings and weekends as necessary. $125,000/year. Consistent with our values as a collective, all staff receive salaries based on the same hourly rate.

**How to Apply:**

To apply, please send a cover letter, resume, and three references to the Hiring Committee, Sylvia Rivera Law Project, 147 W. 24 Street, 5 Floor, New York, NY 10011 or to .

**Applications should be submitted by September 30, 2024. they will be accepted on a rolling basis until the position is filled.**

*SRLP is an equal opportunity employer.* Transgender folks and people of color are strongly encouraged to apply.

***No phone calls please. We will only contact applicants we intend to interview.***

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $125,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10011 (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10011: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10011

title: Merchandise Supervisor
description:
**Job Title:** Seasonal Merchandising Supervisor

**Reports To:** The **Seasonal Merchandising Supervisor** will report to the Client Services Supervisor, Client Services Manager, or equivalent leadership.

**Typical hours: Mondays-Fridays, Weekends if needed (25 hours/week)**

**Job Overview:**

This **Merchandising Associate** position is responsible for facilitating and processing merchandise sales within the Rockefeller Center Observation Deck souvenir gift shops.

Overall, this position continuously offers the highest level of service to all client and SPS employees while maintaining a professional image of the company by providing prompt, courteous and efficient service.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Check-in with Site Supervisor or Supports Supervisors.
* Collect the daily task sheet from the support Supervisors, which will outline specific merchandising tasks.
* Remove any overstocked merchandise from racks or shelves, ensuring that display shelves are not stocked with selling items.
* Face, fold, size, and label all items in the shops to maintain a neat and organized appearance.
* Utilize the daily task sheet to note any additional requirements or comments for each shop.
* Oversee the placement and maintenance of promotional signage in the gift shop.
* Rotate displays regularly to reflect seasonal changes and promotions.
* Dust and change displays periodically to keep them fresh and visually appealing.
* If additional merchandise is needed, promptly communicate with support staff to have the items brought up and stored in the designated area.
* At the end of each shift, return the completed daily task sheet to the receptionist's folder.

**Competencies**:

* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Excellent hospitality and customer service skills.
* PC skills MS Office Suite experience.
* Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Good organizational skills.
* Requires knowledge and understanding of technological ordering systems and ability to comprehend instructions.
* Possesses ability to work independently and capable of completing projects.
* Adaptable and flexible to needs at a moment's notice.

**Requirements**:

* Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.
* Effective communication and teamwork abilities.
* Ability to work independently and take initiative.
* Friendly and approachable demeanor.
* Prior experience in merchandising or retail is a plus.

**Qualifications and Education Requirements:**

* High School Diploma (or equivalent) required.
* 1-2+ years prior work experience preferred.
* Ability to work assigned work hours determined by manager.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills.
* Analytical abilities and aptitude in problem-solving.
* Superb written and verbal English communication skills.
* Current knowledge or ability to learn computer-based systems required for functions of position.
* Required to maintain an overall professional appearance and attitude.
* Adhere to all policies and procedures required.

**Physical Demands:**

* Fine and/or gross motor skills, including the ability to grasp, lift and/or carry or otherwise move packages on a standard wheeled cart with a load capacity of 60 lbs.
* Ability to walk, bend, kneel, stand, and/or sit for an extended period of time.
* Manual dexterity required for operating office machinery (phone, copy machines, binding equipment, etc.).
* Ability to lift or move 40 lbs. or greater frequently.
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
* Must be able to utilize computer monitor and keyboard.

**Travel: None or Negligible**

**Other Duties:**

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

***About SPS:***

**SPS** is an award-winning employer of choice offering outsourcing solutions that leverage Intelligent Automation (Artificial Intelligence & Robotic Process Automation) in more than 22 countries across the globe.

In North America, our services include Mailroom Management (both physical and digital), Office Services such as Reception, Lobby Concierge and Conference Room Management in addition to Document Processing Services utilizing leading edge technologies. Our clients today are companies in sectors such as banking, insurance, legal, higher education, advertising and other professional services, including many Fortune 500 companies.

SPS is committed to delivering high caliber outsourcing experience to our clients and offering our employees challenging and exciting career opportunities throughout the North America region and globally. SPS is committed to investing in the professional development of our employees and offers competitive comprehensive benefits and diverse development training programs that lead to building careers.

*At SPS we embrace the uniqueness of our employees and are committed to the fair and equal treatment of all people, applicants, and employees by promoting a culture of access, inclusion, equity and diversity.*

*SPS provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual and reproductive health choices, national origin, age, disability, genetics, military status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation and/or any other status protected by law.*

title: Sales Representative
description:
***\\*\\*IN OFFICE POSITION. NOT REMOTE\\*\\****

**Company Overview:**  
Y LIFT is a dynamic and rapidly growing aesthetics company dedicated to delivering innovative solutions to our clients. We pride ourselves on our commitment to excellence, integrity, and fostering a collaborative and supportive work environment. As we expand our operations, we are seeking a talented Sales Representative to join our team and contribute to our continued success.

**Position Overview:**  
We are looking for an experienced Sales Representative who will be responsible for building and maintaining strong relationships with our key clients. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of exceeding sales targets, identifying opportunities for growth, and providing exceptional customer service. This role requires strong communication and interpersonal skills, as well as the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.

**Responsibilities:**

* Develop and maintain relationships with key clients, serving as the primary point of contact for all account-related matters.
* Understand clients' business objectives and challenges, and provide strategic guidance and solutions to help them achieve their goals.
* Collaborate with internal teams, including sales, marketing, and product development, to ensure the successful delivery of products and services to clients.
* Identify new business opportunities within existing accounts and work proactively to upsell and cross-sell additional products and services.
* Prepare and deliver regular reports and presentations to clients, showcasing performance metrics, insights, and recommendations for improvement.
* Negotiate contracts and pricing agreements with clients, ensuring that terms are favorable for both parties.
* Stay up-to-date on industry trends and market developments, and share insights with clients to help them stay ahead of the competition.
* Handle any issues or concerns raised by clients in a timely and professional manner, and work to resolve them to the client's satisfaction.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field is preferred.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in sales or account management.
* Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets and KPIs.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build rapport and trust with clients at all levels.
* Excellent negotiation and problem-solving abilities.
* Highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple accounts simultaneously.
* Proficiency in CRM software and Microsoft Office Suite.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, and adapt quickly to changing priorities.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses
* Comprehensive health insurance (50% company paid)
* Paid time off and holidays
* Professional development opportunities
* Collaborative and supportive work environment

Join our team and be part of a dynamic environment where your skills and expertise will make a significant impact on our continued success.

**Essential Job Functions**

· Provide rehabilitation services including Assertiveness/Self-Advocacy Training, Community Integration/Resource Development, Daily Living Skills Training, Health Services, Medication Management and Training, Rehabilitation Counseling, Skill Development Services, Socialization, Substance Abuse Prevention Services, and Symptom Management.

· Responsible for implementation of Medication Policies and Procedures.

· Responsible for reporting, maintaining, reviewing, and regularly updating ongoing records according to Documentation Guidelines and for compliance with OMH and Medicaid regulations and Agency Policies and Procedures.

· Required to be ambulatory and present and able to perform all job functions without limitations, up to and including life preservation activities.

· Provide for the health and safety of the residents and maintain the physical environment.

· Responsible for behavioral interventions/crisis management involving immediate attention in order to ensure the safety of residents and staff and provide feedback to residents concerning acceptable and/or unacceptable behavior. Complete and submit NIMRS Reports to Supervisory Staff as needed.

· Responsible to comply with all Agency Policies including Agency Code of Conduct and Confidentiality Policies, Medicaid Compliance Program and Protocols and Justice Center Code of Conduct.

· Maintain attendance and punctuality. Notify supervisor when late or absent. Provide adequate notice when scheduling time off.

**Job Duties include but are not limited to:**

· Assist residents to establish linkages with mental health/health clinics, vocational, educational, financial, social, substance abuse prevention and recreational resources as needed; maintain at least monthly contact with mental health and designated vocational linkages as well as other service providers as necessary.

· Assist residents in arranging transportation to day programs, appointments, and other program related activities. Provide transportation as needed; must use own personal vehicle if agency vehicle is unavailable.

· Attend and participate in staff meetings, training sessions, ISP Meetings, Quality Assurance Audits, including Utilization Review Meetings and other relevant meetings as scheduled.

· Responsible for ensuring residents receive the necessary degree of support to facilitate transition to a less supervised setting.

· Reports to assigned supervisor.

title: Assistant Manager, Market Research
description:
Job Description Summary:
A Market Research Assistant manager is responsible for managing projects to support senior marketing staff as the executive marketing researcher and analyzing the market/industry. Their duties include handling interdepartmental communications, Operating and management of consumer research platforms to obtain marketing insights, formation and maintenance of relationships with various stakeholders, preparing data reports in a clear format and conducting market research to predict market/product/consumer trends, and measuring marketing impact.
Job Description:
The ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting thorough market research and analysis to support our company's strategic decision-making process. As a Market Research Associate, you will collect and analyze data, identify market trends, and provide actionable insights to drive business growth. This role requires strong analytical skills, excellent communication abilities, project schedule management skills, and a passion for understanding consumer behavior and market dynamics.
 Responsibilities:* Conduct comprehensive market research mainly utilizing company's consumer research platform, using various methods such as surveys, interviews, product testings, focus groups.
* Operate and maintain the consumer research platform, ensuring its smooth functioning and optimal utilization.
* Analyze data to identify market trends, competitive landscape, and consumer preferences.
* Generate reports and presentations summarizing research findings and actionable insights for internal stakeholders.
* Utilize research data effectively to provide recommendations and support strategic decision-making processes.
* Manage project schedules to ensure timely execution and delivery of research outcomes.
* Communicate effectively with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment and collaboration on market research activities conducted on the platform.
* Collaborate with platform developers to communicate platform operation experiences, provide feedback, and facilitate maintenance work for continuous improvement.
* Analyze data resulting from research projects to identify market trends, consumer preferences, and competitive landscape.
* Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in market research methodologies.
* Uphold high standards of quality, accuracy, and integrity in all research activities and deliverables.


Requirements:* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Economics, or related field.
* 4-5 years of experience in market research, project management, and platform operation.
* Familiarity with various research methodologies such as focus group interviews, consumer testing, and surveys.
* Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex information effectively to diverse audiences.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively.
* Experience in collaborating with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
* Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and quality in all aspects of work.
* Knowledge of consumer behavior, market dynamics, and competitive landscape.
* Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.


We offer a competitive benefits package!

title: B2B Marketing Associate
description:
Job Description Summary:
Once an entry-level employee demonstrates competence to perform basic tasks, more opportunities to expand the role usually happen. The next possible step could consist of assisting the creative process, presenting reports and forecasts to company leadership/potential clients, and coordinating a special event or project.

description:

International Sales Registration:* Monitor and support international sales registration processes in alignment with the International Planogram (POG).
* Ensure compliance with regional and market-specific requirements to facilitate smooth product launches and sales activities across global markets.


Cosmetics Brand Global Marketing Management:* Lead and manage global marketing initiatives for our cosmetics brand, ensuring consistent messaging and positioning across all international markets.

title: B2B Marketing Manager
description:
Job Description Summary:
The Marketing Manager is responsible for planning, developing, and implementing the overall company's B2B marketing strategy to strengthen sales performance and operate marketing events such as trade shows. The ideal candidate will have experience managing large-scale events, analyzing market segments, and creating impactful marketing programs aligning with the company's overall business goals.
Job Description:* Market Analysis: Conduct strategic analysis of market segments, focusing on current and potential customers, as well as competitors, to identify opportunities for trade show participation and overall marketing strategy.
* Research and Reporting: Present research findings and actionable recommendations to upper management to inform decision-making and support business objectives.
* Event Coordination: Plan, coordinate, and execute marketing events, with a primary focus on trade shows. This includes managing all logistical aspects, from vendor coordination to attendee scheduling and customer invitations.
* Content Management: Maintain and update marketing content and sales support materials to ensure accuracy, relevance, and accessibility for existing and potential customers.
* Marketing Strategy Execution: Implement marketing plans for both existing and new products, ensuring alignment with broader company goals. Develop and manage marketing programs to drive product awareness and customer engagement.
* Internal Communication: Liaise with upper management and other departments to secure approvals and align external communications with the company’s messaging strategy.
* Lead Management: Generate and manage leads obtained from trade show events, ensuring they are effectively passed to the Sales team for follow-up.
* Promotional Material Development: Create and prepare promotional materials to showcase products at trade shows, ensuring they are engaging and aligned with brand messaging.
* Post-Event Evaluation: Conduct thorough post-event follow-ups and evaluations, analyzing the effectiveness of trade show participation and providing recommendations for future improvements.
* Vendor Relations: Manage relationships with vendors, ensuring all aspects of trade show participation, including booth setup and promotional material distribution, are handled efficiently and within budget.
* Project Management: Complete assignments and meet deadlines according to project plans, ensuring all tasks related to trade shows are executed seamlessly.


Qualifications:* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business or a related field.
* Proven experience (8+ years) in B2B marketing, with a strong focus on trade show management and event coordination.
* Demonstrated ability to develop and execute successful marketing strategies that align with overall business objectives.
* Solid understanding of market research, competitive analysis, and customer segmentation to inform marketing initiatives.
* Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple large-scale events and marketing campaigns simultaneously.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with experience reporting to senior management and collaborating with cross-functional teams.
* Creative thinking and problem-solving skills to develop compelling marketing programs and promotional materials.
* Ability to work independently, manage vendors, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills, particularly in managing event logistics and post-event evaluations.

title: (Full Time) Medical Courier
description:
Capstone Logistics is looking for an Independent Contractor with their own vehicle 2013 or newer. As a Medical Courier, you will be a vital part of our team, responsible for timely and secure delivery of medical supplies from various medical facilities in Greenwich and surrounding areas. You would start each day from the same location in Guilford.

**Need to be able to start IMMEDIATELY!**

**Monday - Friday: 1pm - 7pm** 

**Driver needs to understand regular attendance is important.**

**VACCINATIONS ARE REQUIRED**

***MUST WORK EVERY DAY DURING THE POSTED/AGREED UPON HOURS***

***This position is paid PER LOADED MILE(anytime you have a delivery on you is when you are being paid)***

***Easy Requirements***

* 18 years of age or older
* A valid driver’s license and current insurance
* A CLEAN Motor Vehicle Report
* Ability to meet vehicle requirements **(Driver must be listed on vehicle Insurance)**
* Must have and be able to use a smartphone
* All vendors will operate their own delivery vehicle. Stable routes and pay!
* No call/no shows, Repeated Call-outs: will result in termination.

***Drive Forward with Capstone***

* Be Your Own Boss W9/1099
* Weekly Pay
* Direct Deposit or Prepaid Card
* Minimal weekly deductions
* SIMPLE AND SPEEDY ENROLLMENT

Capstone Logistics has been in business for over 20 years and have developed a large customer base and many opportunities for Independent Contractor Couriers to succeed and grow their business. **Successful Independent Contractors for this work are expected to work with a sense of urgency while maintaining a professional relationship with our Partners and Customers.**

title: Doggy Daycare - Dog Lovers Wanted (All Roles, All Shifts)
description:
Working at a doggie daycare facility is a fun but serious job. As someone recently said, "I get it, it is watching and caring for living things, not a stack of sweaters at The Gap." It is vastly rewarding and something that we, at Pets a Go Go, take pride in daily but to be clear it is just about petting puppies all day.

Qualifications:

* Must love dogs, obviously! Be patient and tolerate of dogs in general but barking, dog waste and dog hair are part of the job every day.
* Professional experience working with dogs preferred but not required.
* Have a general knowledge of dog breeds and not be fearful of any breed.
* Ability to multi-task and remain calm in a fast-paced, occasionally stressful environment.
* Able to remember 100+ dogs' names and personalities.
* Able to stand for long periods of time and be physically active throughout the shift (including bending, crouching, walking, etc.) This is a physically demanding job.
* Drug and drama free.
* Ability to lift 50 pounds with no restrictions.
* Must be 18 years of age, no exceptions at this time.
* Some roles will require a senior and clean driver's license.
* Some roles will require front-facing customer service and POS capabilitie.

Scheduling Requirements:

* A minimum of 2 days/nights per week and 20 hours per week is required. We prefer full time commitments of 35-40 hours per week. Paid overtime is available.
* Possible shifts are include early morning and evening work. Limited overnight shifts available at this time.
* Calling off or being late is unacceptable as this affects everyone's day and the previous staff's ability to leave.

Responsibilities:

* Maintaining and facilitating safe and fun play for groups of social dogs in an off-leash play setting.
* Proactively stop rough or inappropriate interactions between dogs of similar size and temperament.
* Clean up dog urine, feces and vomit.
* Vacuum, mop, wash dog dishes, overall cleaning and maintenance of the daycare.
* Communicate dogs' behavior and/or health issues to a Manager or Owner depending on role.

Benefits Include:

* Casual dress environment
* No need to cover tattoos
* Above industry standard pay and smaller dog to attendant ratios.
* 401K
* Continuing Education Opportunities.
* Opportunity for advancement to management.
* Discounted services when not on duty including daycare and boarding.
* Discount on all retail.
* Working with fun dog people and being with dogs all day!!

Serious applicants should apply here or email thepawsquad@petsagogo.com. A PDF fill-in form is available on our website and in our retail locations as well.

Please explain which of the following roles you are most interested:

* Assistant Manager
* Doggie Daycare Attendant/Pet Taxi Driver

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
**Overview**
------------



We are seeking a skilled and motivated Maintenance Technician to join our dynamic team in New York. In this role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring the smooth operation of our manufacturing facility by maintaining and troubleshooting various industrial automation equipment. If you have a passion for problem-solving and a strong background in electrical and mechanical systems, we want to hear from you!


**Responsibilities**
--------------------


* Perform routine maintenance and repairs on industrial equipment, including PLCs, servo motors, and VFDs.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues with PLC programming, wiring, and CNC machines.
* Create and implement preventive maintenance plans to enhance equipment reliability.
* Conduct electrical and mechanical troubleshooting to minimize downtime.
* Utilize hydraulics and pneumatics knowledge to maintain and repair relevant systems.
* Read and interpret blueprints and electrical schematics for effective troubleshooting.
* Collaborate with team members to ensure efficient operations and communication.
* Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities and equipment performance.
* Adhere to safety protocols and meet physical requirements of the job.

**Qualifications**
------------------


* Proven experience in a manufacturing environment as a Maintenance Technician or similar role.
* Strong skills in PLC troubleshooting and programming.
* Experience with servo motors, VFDs, and industrial automation equipment.
* Solid understanding of electrical and mechanical troubleshooting techniques.
* Familiarity with hydraulics and pneumatics systems.
* Basic computer skills for documentation and reporting.
* Ability to read blueprints and electrical schematics.
* Excellent communication skills to work effectively with team members.
* Mechanical assembly skills and shop math proficiency.
* Must meet physical requirements of the position.


You should be proficient in:


* PLC Troubleshooting Skills
* Creating Preventive Maintenance Plans
* Electrical Troubleshooting Skills
* Mechanical Troubleshooting Skills
* Hydraulics Experience
* Troubleshooting Industrial Automation Equipment
* PLC Programming Experience
* PLC Wiring Experience
* Troubleshooting CNC Machines
* Experience in a Manufacturing Environment
* Equipment Troubleshooting
* Basic Computer Skills
* Blueprint Reading
* Electrical Schematics
* Excellent Communication Skills
* Mechanical Assembly Skills
* Meets Physical Requirements
* Pneumatics Experience
* Shop Math Skills


Machines & technologies you'll use:


* Programmable Logic Controller (PLC)
* Servo Motors
* Variable Frequency Drives (VFD)

title: Teacher Assistant (Sept 2024)
company: Step by Step Early Childhood Center
description:
**Step by Step Early Childhood Center, Inc.**

NOW HIRING!!!

**Brooklyn, NY**

***Do you love working with children? Do you enjoy seeing children grasp new concepts? Do you have a warm and nurturing personality?*** 

**Teacher's assistant POSITION**

JOB DESCRIPTION:

The Educational Assistant shall meet the requirements for assistant teacher and/or caregiver, set by the regulatory agencies, Health Department and Bureau of Day Care and the sponsoring Board of the Childcare Center, by which she/he is employed.

QUALIFICATIONS:

1. Must be at least 18 years old.

2. CDA certified and/or enrolled in an accredited related-field degree program with 9 credits in Early Childhood, childhood or any related field; or CDA

program.

4. Nurturing, mature person

RESPONSIBILITIES:

1. To implement chosen curriculum, program by the center, under the direction of the

group teacher.

2. To provide a nurturing and caring environment for all enrolled children.

3. To serve nutritious meals and healthy snacks to children.

4. To assist in toilet training/diaper changing, toilet training and hygiene maintenance.

5. To take responsibility for keeping equipment and material accessible and in good

condition, to encourage maximum constructive use by children.

6. To take responsibility for maintaining the health and safety of all children in care. To

alert the group teacher of any health, medical and/or behavioral issues a child may

exhibit.

7. To report any specific student difficulties, academic or social concerns to the group

teacher, and educational director and observe newly arrived students using developmental

screening.

8. To always maintain a clean and orderly environment.

9. To have constant and competent supervision of all children throughout play.

title: Robotics Process Automation (RPA) Developer
description:
Management Level


F
Equiniti is a leading international provider of shareholder, pension, remediation, and credit technology. With over 6000 employees, it supports 37 million people in 120 countries.


EQ US is a leading provider of ownership data management, analytics and advisory services to public and private companies as well as corporate issuers and mutual funds. EQ offers a comprehensive product set, including transfer agency services, cap table management, equity compensation services, proxy solicitation and advisory services, private company solutions and bankruptcy claims administration services. Affiliates include, D.F. King and Co., Inc., Astrella Private Company Solutions, Inc., and Donlin, Recano & Company, Inc. Learn more at: www.equiniti.com/us


EQ's vision is to be the leading global share registrar, offering complementary services to its client base and our values set the core foundations to our success. We are TRUSTED to deliver on our commitments, COMMERCIAL in building long term value, COLLABORATIVE in our approach and we IMPROVE by continually enhancing our skills and services. There has never been a better time to join EQ.


**Role Summary**

The Robotic Process Automation (RPA) Developer will deliver the automated processes within a cross-functional, collaborative team and follow an Agile delivery methodology


* Option to work remotely

**Core** **Duties/Responsibilities**

* Serve as a practitioner in Robotic Process Automation tools (BluePrism), to translate business needs into RPA solutions and automations
* Conceptualize/design RPA process solutions in accordance with standard RPA design principles and conventions (Robotic Operating Model) and prescribed RPA architecture
* Configure new RPA processes and use core workflow principles that are efficient, well-structured, maintainable, and easy to understand
* Prepare required solution, process and procedural specification documents, test plans, end-user training material, configuration documents and production solution support documentation
* Support existing processes and implement change requirements as part of a structured change control process
* Problem-solve issues (configuration, integration and security) that arise in day-to-day running of RPS processes and provide timely responses and solutions as required
* Create, document, and execute test procedures and scenarios for the pre-UAT phases, and support the operational teams during the UAT and rollout phases

**Skills, Capabilities and Attributes**

The successful candidate will demonstrate the following experience, skills and behaviors:


Bachelor's degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field plus two (2) years* ' experience in the position offered as a Software Developer or in a related position
Must have two (2) years' experience in the Financial Services or Fintech domain with all of the following: Process-mapping and process re-design; building Blue Prism Robots and handling them end-to-end, including business and stakeholder requirements meeting SLAs to deliver the automations on time; building Multi-BOT Architecture; using and maintaining on-cloud BOTs including auto logons, reboots, and whitelisting URLs, meeting network and database requirements to run the BOTs in production; "Surface Automation" to automate legacy applications with old frameworks and technologies and debug issues within that method; using OCR (Optical Character Recognition) to read PDF data documents; serving as Blue Prism Admin, Analyst, Tester, Controller and Developer.* 
Most possess the following certification:* Blue Prism Associate Developer or Blue Prism Professional Developer

**Compensation**

* $143,000-150,000 per year

**Equal Opportunity Statement**

We are an equal opportunity employer and make employment decisions without regard to race, creed, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, marital status, national origin, age, disability, family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service, status with regard to public assistance, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law.
