title: 2025 Summer Program- Graduate- Supervision
company: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
description:
Company
Federal Reserve Bank of New York
The Graduate Summer Associate Program provides you with the opportunity to gain valuable work experience at a unique institution. Through advanced project-based work and professional development activities, you’ll get an extensive understanding of the New York Fed’s consequential and dynamic work. You’ll also be given the opportunity to enhance your business skills through critical financial analysis, formal presentations, research and writing—all designed to prepare you for what’s next in your education and career journey. As an associate, you’ll be assigned to a particular business area while also having opportunities to collaborate with other associates, other analysts, and employees from around the Bank. In addition to your daily responsibilities, you’ll attend weekly presentations hosted by New York Fed leaders. These presentations aim to provide an extensive overview of the Bank's responsibilities and operations and offer a unique opportunity to learn about full-time career opportunities, as our summer program is the primary recruitment source for the New York Fed's fulltime campus hiring.  

  

Working at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York positions you at the center of the financial world with a unique perspective on national and international markets and economies. You will work in an environment with a diverse group of experienced professionals to foster and support the safety, soundness, and vitality of our economic and financial systems.  

  

The Bank believes in work flexibility to balance the demands of work and life while also connecting and collaborating with our colleagues in person. Employees can expect to be in the office a couple of days per week as needed for meetings and team collaboration and should live within a commutable distance.
What we do:
The Supervision Group supervises and regulates financial institutions in the Second District of the Federal Reserve System. We apply our unique insight to influence and execute Federal Reserve System supervision in order to promote a safe, sound, and stable banking and financial system. Staff in the Group assess the safety and soundness of domestic banking institutions and operations of foreign banking organizations in the district through periodic onsite evaluations and offsite financial analysis and surveillance. The Group also analyzes issues and developments to identify emerging supervisory risks and develop domestic and international supervisory policy.
The Supervision Group is comprised of the following functions: Consumer Compliance; Large & Foreign Banking Organizations; Supervisory Policy & Strategy; Large Institution Supervision Coordinating Committee (LISCC) Programs; Regional, Community and Foreign Institutions & Financial Market Infrastructure.
Program Description:
The Graduate Summer Associate Program provides outstanding graduate students with the opportunity to gain valuable work experience with a unique institution. Through advanced work assignments and professional development activities, Summer Associates are provided with an extensive understanding of the work of the New York Fed. Summer Associates will be given the opportunity to enhance their business skills through critical financial analysis, formal presentations, research, and writing. Summer Associates are assigned to a particular business area for the summer, and they will also have opportunities for collaboration with other Summer Associates, Summer Analysts and full-time employees. In addition to their daily responsibilities, Summer Associates attend weekly presentations hosted by senior management. These presentations provide an extensive overview of the New York Fed’s responsibilities and operations and offer a unique opportunity to learn about full-time career opportunities upon graduation. The Summer Associate Program is the primary recruiting event for the New York Fed's full-time campus hiring.
What we are looking for:
The Supervision Group’s Summer Associate Program is open to graduate students who will complete their studies and graduate in Winter 2025 or Spring 2026 with demonstrated and applicable full-time work experience. As a Summer Associate, you must have a demonstrated interest in economics, public policy, and/or finance and a strong academic record.
Additional requirements include:* Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to synthesize information and explain it
* Organized and resourceful, with the ability to work as part of a team and independently
* Ability to assimilate new information and learn new tools/systems
* Curiosity and critical thinking skills
* Proficiency in MS Office Suite; statistical software tools experience a plus (e.g., Macros, VBA, SQL, Stata).
* Proficiency in data visualization


 To Apply: Please include a resume, cover letter and unofficial transcript.
Applications for our 2025 Graduate program close on October 11th, 2024 at 11:59pm EST\\*. For a full breakdown of the recruitment timeline, visit our website. This is a paid internship. Please note, summer housing is not provided.
Salary Range: Your regular wages for the 10 weeks will be paid on a semi-monthly basis and will be calculated based on an annual salary of $94,900, less applicable taxes. *We believe in transparency at the NY Fed. This salary range reflects a variety of skills and experiences candidates may bring to the job. We pay individuals along this range based on their unique backgrounds. Whether you’re stretching into the job or are a more seasoned candidate, we aim to pay competitively for your contributions*.  

Our Touchstone Behaviors—Communicate Authentically, Collaborate Inclusively, Drive Progress, Develop Others, and Take Ownership—help shape the culture of the Bank. They also provide a shared language for how we work together and achieve success, and they set clear expectations for leading with impact at every stage of your career with us. Learn more. *The New York Fed expects its employees to perform their duties with honesty, integrity, and impartiality, and without improper preferential treatment of any person.* *Learn more about our code of conduct and conflicts of interest rules.* *The Federal Reserve Bank of New York is committed to a diverse workforce and to providing equal employment opportunity to all persons without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, genetic information, disability, pregnancy, or military service.* *We value accessibility for all candidates and are happy to provide an accommodation or assistance. Please email us at* ny.leaves@ny.frb.org *and we’ll be glad to help.* *Please note, this is a dedicated e-mail box designed exclusively to assist applications with accommodation requests in relation to our recruiting process. All other inquires including the status of applications will not receive a response from this e-mail box.*  

This is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, performance standards or requirements, efforts, skills or working conditions associated with the job. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current job, management reserves the right to revise the job or to require that other or different tasks be performed when circumstances change.  

 This position requires access to confidential supervisory information (CSI) and/or Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) information. Access to CSI and FOMC information is limited to U.S. citizens, lawful permanent residents, individuals who meet the definition of “protected individual” under 8 U.S.C. § 1324b(a)(3), and certain other nonimmigrants. All non-U.S. citizens authorized to access CSI and/or FOMC information must sign a declaration of intent to expeditiously become a lawful permanent resident and thereafter a U.S. citizen when eligible.

title: Pool Attendant (for TUESDAY only)
description:
Gansevoort Meatpacking Hotel is looking for a Pool Attendant/ Lifeguard with previous hospitality experience. During off season, this is 1 shift only - TUESDAY, with potential to pick up additional shifts occasionally.

Send your resume to be considered. Below is the job description to learn more about job responsibilities and requirements.

**Summary of Position:** The primarily objective is to ensure the safety and well-being of the Hotel Guests and pool visitors. Keep the pool area clean and well maintained and also to ensure water hygienic and safety standards are met at all times. Additionally welcome Guests to the pool facility and always be courteous and friendly to guests, be attentive to their needs, handle problems in a professional manner and are conscious of the importance of safety.

**Primary Functions:**

· To serve as a Gansevoort Hotel Group Brand Ambassador and maintain integrity of brand standards and goals.

· To uphold and comply with Coyle Standards and Gansevoort Core Values at all times.

· Establish and maintain standards of a 5 star service.

· To provide a safe and comfortable experience for all guests of the Pool by offering assistance, service, and follow up to guests.

· To greet all guests and offer assistance, maintaining cleanliness in all pool and sundeck areas, offering pool towels, etc.

· **To** rescue swimmers in danger of drowning and administer first aid.

**Specific Accountabilities:**

· Welcome guests in a proper manner following GATSBY and Coyle standards.

· Be present at the pool area at all times, never leaving pool unattended. Check with manager / supervisor before leaving work area for any reason.

· Inform guests and patrons about pool facilities, functions, services and hours of operations.

· Consistently offer professional, friendly and engaging service.

· Monitor pool area and safety of guests. Observe the swimming area for dangerous conditions, unusual or unsafe activities, and swimmers who are struggling.

· Restrict guest from using any kind of glassware near the pool area.

· Verify that all entering the Pool area are registered guests of the hotel (unless listed as a VIP guest of the owners or Management) anyone that is not registered to the hotel as a guest or VIP of owners or Management may not enter the pool area at any time.

· Ensure the sun loungers are clean, umbrellas are in working shape and, in the correct position and proper working condition.

· Ensures that the umbrellas are fixed properly to their units and ensures that when the umbrellas are not in use, they are tidied down for safety precautions.

· Report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to the manager, attend and complete safety training and certifications as required by the management.

· Provide towels to guests and ensure needs are meet.

· General cleaning of pool area (no trash, dirty towels, magazines, glasses, etc). Assist in the cleanliness and the daily upkeep of the pool area.

· Communicate with manager any pool items that need repair, replacing, upkeep.

· Renew required certifications when they expire.

· Maintain a professional appearance.

· Attend all scheduled meetings and training sessions.

· Attend department meetings as scheduled.

· Be active participant and support your team in achieving the hotel goals and objectives.

· Perform other duties as requested by Management.

**Required Skills/Qualifications:**

· High School Diploma or GED.

· Prior Lifeguarding experience preferred.

· Must have current, up-to-date certificates (CPR/AED for the Professional Rescuer, Lifeguarding/First Aid).

· Customer Service Skills and good Communication Skills.

· Good listening skills.

· Attention to detail and organizational skills.

· Ability to multitask and prioritize.

· Ability to function in a noisy, hectic and crowed environment.

· Ability to remain calm under pressure.

· Ability to handle guests’ complaints.

· Neat and clean appearance.

· Flexible to work schedules to include morning/evenings/night, as well as weekends and holidays.

· Being a team player and ability to successfully pass on information from one team member to another.

· Ability to react calmly and effectively in emergency situations.

· Ability to perform rescue actions, administer first aid and CPR.

**Physical Requirements:**

· Must be able to be standing/mobile/stationary for at least 7 hours a day, 35 hours a week.

· Periodically fast paced strides are required to go from one part of property to other.

· Must regularly lift/carry/move 60 pounds of force.

· Must be able to seize, grasp, turn and hold objects with hands.

· Occasionally kneel, bend, crouch and climb is required.

title: Receptionist
description:
Ray Catena Mercedes-Benz is currently looking for a front desk receptionist.

The front desk is crucial in playing a key role in maintaining our store’s reputation and integrity.

You will be responsible for processing service transactions as well as providing professional, courteous and exceptional service to our clients.

A team player who is focused on providing exemplary customer service.

Excellent communication skills; both written and verbal.

title: Childcare Teacher - Hiring ASAP
description:
Futures start here. Where first steps, new friendships, and confident learners are born. At KinderCare Learning Companies, the first and only early childhood education provider recognized with the **Gallup Exceptional Workplace Award**, we offer a variety of early education and child care options for families. We pave the way for their lifelong learning journey ahead. And we want you to join us in shaping a future we can all be proud to share—in neighborhoods, at work, and in schools nationwide.

Our teachers, center staff, and field leaders are the heart and soul of our business. When you join us, you’ll be directly supporting children and their education every day and experiencing the trials and triumphs that come with that responsibility. But you’ll never be alone. You’ll do it all with a village of dedicated and passionate humans who care as much about helping kids reach their highest potential as you do. The best part? Seeing the positive impact, you’re making on the lives of young learners and their families—and knowing that your work matters.

**When you join our team as a teacher, you will...**

· Implement KinderCare's curriculum to meet children’s unique needs.

· Create a safe, nurturing environment where children can play and learn.

· Partner and connect with parents to provide the best care and education for their children.

· Collaborate for center success with staff and leadership to achieve enrollment, accreditation, and engagement goals.

· Cultivate positive relationships with families, teachers, state licensing authorities, community contacts and corporate partners.

**Qualifications:**

· Outstanding customer service skills, strong organizational skills, and the ability to multi-task

· CPR and First Aid Certification or willingness to obtain.

· Meet state specific qualifications:

· Active Child Development Associate (CDA) Credential (or willing to obtain)

· Physically able to use a computer with basic proficiency, lift a minimum of 40 pounds, and work indoors or outdoors

· Able to assume postures in low levels to allow physical and visual contact with children, see and hear well enough to keep children safe, and engage in physical activity with children

· Read, write, understand, and speak English to communicate with children and their parents in English

**Benefits:**

Our benefits meet you where you are. We’re here to help our employees navigate the integration of work and life:

· **Investing in you is an investment in our future:**

· Robust tenure-based pay model that begins at 1 year of service for qualified individuals

· Discounted child care benefits

· Medical, dental, and vision benefits for your family (pets, too!)

· Mental health and personal growth with employee assistance programs

· Health and wellness programs, paid time off and discounts for work necessities, such as cell phones. And so much more!

We operate research-backed, accredited, and customizable programs in more than 2,000 sites and centers across40 states and the District of Columbia. As we expand, we’re matching the needs of more and more families, dynamic work environments, and diverse communities from coast to coast. Because we believe every family deserves access to high-quality child care, no matter who they are or where they live. Every day, you’ll help bring this mission to life by building community and delivering exceptional experiences. And if you’re anything like us, you’ll come for the work, and stay for the people.

\\*Our highest priority has always been to keep our employees, children, families, and communities as safe and healthy as possible. In addition to our proactive partnership with WELL Building Institute, we are also subject to state law, local ordinances, and Health Department requirements for employees working in child care, school facilities, and corporate work spaces.

KinderCare Learning Companies is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law.

title: Warehouse and Store Operations Associate
description:
**Summary:** The Branch Operations Associate provides support to the Branch Leader with the day-to-day store operations including sales growth, safety, customer service and inventory control. The ideal candidate is customer-oriented and has excellent problem-solving skills.

**Job Duties and Responsibilities:**

· Complete all warehouse activities such as, receiving, storing, picking, shipping materials and inventory control.

· Transports incoming and outgoing materials to designated areas utilizing appropriate tools/vehicles to accomplish task including but not limited to hand dolly, forklift, electric dolly, and/or pallet jack.

· Inspect cylinders for defects/test date issues to ensure compliance with government/company policies.

· Responsible for the safe loading and unloading of all full and empty cylinders and hard goods.

· Ownership of the entire customer experience. This includes appropriate product selection and accurate order entry and maintenance

. Perform research and attend manufacturer-based training to understand the specifications, features, and benefits of our product offering.

· Understand, agree, and commit to the safety guidelines and behaviors set forth through our organization and comply with all process standards including wearing personal protective equipment when required

· Cleans and maintains company vehicles on a regular basis and when necessary.

· Occasionally make deliveries while following all vehicle state laws and driving in a safe manner

· Plan trip logistics and obtain necessary documents to transport goods.

· Ensure material is secured properly and compliant with safety requirements.

· Ability to adapt to a changing work environment

title: Retail Sales – Part Time
description:
We are happy you have taken time out of your day to check out this Retail Sales Associate opportunity with Lowe's. Do any of the following statements match your current goals?* I'm at least 18 years old, and I want to share my whole self in an inclusive work environment
* I want to work for a company who welcomes and appreciates the military community
* I'm retired, but I still want to work part-time or full-time
* I currently have a job and need supplementary income
* I want to build a career with a company that doesn’t require a four-year degree
* I'm a stay-at-home parent, ready to return to work
* I need flexibility in my schedule because I have children or other responsibilities
* I'm interested in debt-free education, tuition reimbursement, or certificate programs
* I want to learn a skilled trade and possibly start my own company
* I am bilingual
* I love DIY projects

  

Whatever your need for employment, we at Lowe's believe we can help you build a better life and career, and we are all-in to help you achieve your goals. We are hiring immediately for this role, so make sure you apply today.  

  

**Here's what you will do in this role:**  

As a Lowe's **Retail Sales Associate – Part-Time**, you are the key to our customers' positive shopping experiences. You will be the smiling person who greets customers as they enter our doors or shop our aisles. You will engage customers regarding the types of projects they are working on and how you may help. You will guide shoppers to the right products or introduce them to the appropriate sales specialist who can assist. As you learn more about your department and Lowe's, you will understand which products naturally go together. It will be your responsibility to ensure that you share this knowledge with your customers. Here's an example: If a customer is looking for a lamp, do they need a shade? What about light bulbs? See, it's that simple!  

  

Lowe's offers jobs for people who aren't interested in sitting behind a desk for hours. Instead of answering phones, you might be in the store or the garden center, walking, talking to our customers, watering plants, and restocking items. Depending on your department, some lifting (building materials, paint, or maybe mulch) may be required with or without assistance.  

  

**What's in It for You?**  

Beyond the chance to make a difference for customers and teammates, each day will allow you to learn, grow, and celebrate wins together with your Lowe's team. Our associates enjoy the following benefits:  

* A 10% discount on everything at Lowe's
* Eligible for debt-free education and skilled trade programs
* Access to comprehensive physical, mental, and financial benefits\\*
* Opportunity to earn quarterly bonuses
* Flexible schedules to fit your lifestyle
* Career growth—over 50% of our leaders started as hourly associates

  

**Your Day at Lowe's**  

* Deliver excellent customer service
* Help customers find products and provide recommendations
* Help load customer merchandise
* Restock merchandise

  

**Requirements**  

* Be able to lift up to 25lbs. unassisted, or over 25lbs assisted.
* Possess 6 months experience operating common retail technology, smartphones, tablets, or computers.
* For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, email HRServiceCenter@lowes.com.

  

***Bilingual applicants are encouraged to apply.***  

  

* Benefits offerings change each year and eligibility varies. For the most up-to-date breakdown of what's available to you, visit MyLowesBenefits.com.

  

***Bilingual, Military, and Veteran applicants are encouraged to apply.***

title: 2024-2025 Middle School Permanent Substitute Teacher (LIC)
description:
**2024-2025 Middle School Permanent Substitute Teacher (LIC)**


**Mission Statement:** The Growing Up Green Charter School (GUGCS) supports children to be conscious, contributing members of their community through a rigorous, anti-racist, anti-bias, curriculum and an engaging green culture. Graduates of GUGCS will be prepared to attend high-performing schools where their interdisciplinary academic foundation, knowledge of sustainability, and a strong sense of self set them apart as leaders and social justice advocates of the future.


**School Culture:** GUGCS teaches students our school culture through our core values: Social Justice, Collaboration, Courage, and Kindness. Students are taught the core values through assemblies, class meetings, and various lessons.


**Classroom Teacher Responsibilities:**


* Learning Environment and classroom management
* Guide and support the Growing Up Green school community in fulfilling its mission and charter goals
* Establish and maintain ongoing positive relationships and constructive interactions with students, families, colleagues, and administration
* Demonstrate commitment to working with diverse populations of families and students and model behavior which depicts respect and a feeling for the dignity and worth for all students
* Use the Responsive Classroom model for community-building, behavior management and communication with students throughout the school building
* Create and maintain an engaging and organized physical classroom environment, making learning accessible to all students


**Curriculum and Instruction**


* Implement GUGCS curricular programs as well as units written in-house
* Collaborate with grade team and coordinators to write rich, integrated units of study
* Adhere to grade-level pacing calendars
* Participate in grade-level team and curricular planning meetings
* Use daily or weekly lesson plans to help drive instruction
* Differentiate instruction in meaningful ways to support student learning
* Work closely with the Special Education department (learning specialists, interventionists, service providers)
* Collaborate with the Special Education and Counseling department to help meet the needs of all students
* Understand and implement interventions recommended for students as outlined by an IEP, support services, or the counseling department


**Assessment**


* Maintain organized records of anecdotal notes and assessments
* Administer formal and informal assessments throughout the school year (examples: Fountas & Pinnell running records, conferencing, end-of-unit rubrics, student portfolios, etc.)
* Use assessment data to modify unit plans, inform groupings, and support student referrals
* Use assessment data to differentiate instruction to meet the needs of all learners
* Share data systems with classroom teachers as necessary


**Parent and Community Engagement**


* Establish and maintain ongoing positive relationships with families
* As necessary communicate social, emotional and academic success and concerns with families
* Encourage our “open door” classroom design, inviting families to regularly be a part of classroom activities


**Related Professional Responsibilities**


* Actively help establish and participate in the school community through weekly staff meetings, PD opportunities, staff committees, school events, etc.
* Fulfill duties, responsibilities, and commitments as outlined in the GUGCS faculty handbook
* Work with an instructional coach on specific goals throughout the year
* Respond productively to ongoing, year-round professional feedback
* Assume any other duties from time to time as delegated by the Executive Director and/or the School Leader (note: The Executive Director and/or the School Leader may make any adjustment in the scope of responsibilities as outlined above which will be in the interest of Growing Up Green)


**Minimum Qualifications:**


* Strong commitment to Growing Up Green Charter School's Mission & Vision
* Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with a team of teachers and administrators
* Knowledge of Responsive Classroom and/or Developmental Designs
* Experience in environmental education a plus
* Ability in integrating technology into teaching
* Excellent organizational skills
* Starting salary is $62,902. Salaries are determined using an equitable compensation scale that accounts for years of experience as lead teacher in a K-12 setting and levels of attained education


**Education:**


* Bachelor's degree required, Master's Degree Preferred
* Teaching experience in middle school grades preferred
* Candidates fluent in Spanish are highly encouraged to apply


**Required Certificates & Licenses:**


* NY Teaching Certification
* NYC DOE/Fingerprinting & Background Clearance

title: Business Recovery Specialist
description:
**Business Recovery Specialist**

**Job Description**

**Program Overview**  
The Staten Island Chamber of Commerce Foundation has established the Small Business Recovery Network (SBRN) to support small businesses throughout Richmond County. The SBRN is designed to assist small businesses in navigating economic challenges and enhancing their resilience.

**Position Overview**  
The SBRN is a comprehensive, multi-pronged approach to assisting small businesses. Central to the success of the SBRN are Business Recovery Specialists, responsible for engaging businesses in specific geographic areas of the borough. The Business Recovery Specialist serves as a liaison to businesses in a specific sector, utilizing a wide range of resources to support the borough’s business community. Business Recovery Specialists connect small businesses to such services as financing, marketing, technology & e-commerce, legal, and general business counseling, among many others.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

· Provide one-on-one consultative support, connect businesses to available resources, and develop individualized service support plans for affected businesses, considering available City, State, and Federal programs, along with existing services offered by the Chambers of Commerce, including micro-lending and finance programs, M/WBE certification, and procurement programs.

· Assist affected businesses with completing relevant applications necessary for securing resources made available by Federal, State, and City government agencies and affiliated programs.

· Collect and enter data to quantify program impact.

· Expect to spend at least 70% of work time in the field.

· Develop business outreach strategies by neighborhood in specific geographic locations.

· Convene groups of businesses and other stakeholders to develop community-wide strategies to support business recovery in their respective areas.

· Organize commercial corridor “walk-throughs” with relevant elected and government officials.

· Facilitate business assistance (assess & advise on business customers’ needs).

· Conduct digital field assessments and surveys onsite at designated places of business.

· Organize area-specific marketing and promotional events to boost consumer engagement along specific commercial corridors.

· Conduct outreach and data collection to quantify the impact on businesses individually and collectively.

· Map affected businesses to provide visual impact reports.

· Keep detailed records of outreach and correspondence. Track and monitor progress in CRM, using Salesforce.

· Assist in creating a localized hub of resources with area BIDs, LDCs, and merchant associations.

· Participate in special projects as directed by Chamber of Commerce staff.

**Desired Qualifications**

title: LMSW Suicide Prevention
company: Mary Pomerantz Advertising for Catholic Charities of Brooklyn & Queens
description:
LMSW Suicide Prevention

Queens, NY

$5K Language Differential (applicable based on the need of the program & community)

When you join the CCBQ Team, you will have an impact on the lives of many. For over 125 years, Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens has been providing quality social services to the neighborhoods of Brooklyn and Queens, and currently offers 160-plus programs and services for children, youth, adults, seniors, and those struggling with mental illness. Our Clinics are community-based which offer a professional and welcoming environment for both clients and staff. The Clinics provide psychotherapeutic and psychopharmacological therapy, as well as individual, group, family therapy, crisis intervention, medication management, case management and collateral sessions. Our staff members follow an approach to health care that emphasizes wellness, recovery, trauma-informed care, and physical-behavioral health integration.

Why you will enjoy being part of our team:  
1. Competitive Salaries and Benefits  
2. Educational Loan Forgiveness  
3. Professional Development (CEUs)  
4. High Quality Supervision  
5. Opportunities for Advancement

STATEMENT OF THE JOB  
The Agency has embraced the concept of a fully integrated system of care for all consumers of service. This requires that staff assess the client’s needs holistically and see it as their responsibility to connect the client with services needed both internal and external to the Agency, regardless of the door through which the consumer enters the system.

Under the direction of a designated Suicide Prevention, Recovery, and Response (SPRR) Initiative Project Director, the Licensed Master Social Worker Suicide Prevention is responsible for direct service to clients in the Agency’s SPRR Initiative. All services are to be delivered in a professional and ethical manner, consistent with best practice tenets. The Licensed Social Worker Suicide Prevention will function as part of a treatment team, maintain mandated levels of service, participate in Agency meetings as required and fully comply with Agency policies and procedures.

The Licensed Master Social Worker Suicide Prevention will perform initial interview, crisis intervention, and ongoing therapy with individuals, groups and families. The Licensed Social Worker Suicide Prevention will adhere to all standards of contract compliance, audit readiness, Agency policies and procedures, and all other regulatory requirements. The Licensed Social Worker Suicide Prevention will work as a member of a team to help ensure the overall integrity and welfare of the Agency.

* Provide direct service, including conducting individual, family, marital and group therapy as dictated by the client’s clinical needs.
* Working in partnership with SPRR Suicide Prevention Specialist, assess the needs of the whole consumer/family including their basic needs such as food, clothing and shelter.
* Ensure that referrals are made to appropriate internal and external services as required to meet the needs of the consumer and their families.
* Meet Agency requirements for qualitative and quantitative documentation. Includes writing progress notes, treatment plans, intake assessments, correspondence regarding clients, termination summaries, encounter forms and all other required documentation.
* Participate in in-service trainings and attend relevant workshops/conferences at the request of or with the permission the Clinical Supervisor and/or Clinical Manager.
* Collect urine specimens for toxicology’s as needed.

QUALIFICATIONS

* Master’s degree in social work from a nationally accredited institution.
* Valid NYS LMSW required.
* Must obtain and maintain all licensure/certifications for which employee is educationally and professionally eligible in NY State.
* Obtain NPI immediately upon employment.
* Excellent Time Management, organizational and computer skills, ability to evaluate and intervene in crisis situations, be flexible, & have excellent oral & written communications skills.
* Bilingual Spanish or Russian speaking preferred.
* Experience in treating/supporting domestic violence victims preferred
* Must often respond to emergency situations.
* Regularly required to talk, hear, walk, stand, & sit.
* Frequently lifts and/or moves up to 10 pounds.
* Able to meet with residents and/or staff throughout facilities.
* Able to travel to multiple locations within the five boroughs as needed.

BENEFITS  
We offer competitive salary and excellent benefits including:

* Generous time off (Vacation/ Personal Days/ Sick Days/ Paid Holidays annually)
* Medical,
* Dental
* Vision
* Retirement Savings with Agency Match
* Transit \\* Flexible Spending Account
* Life insurance
* Training Series and other additional voluntary benefits.

For more information on our organization, please visit our website at: www.ccbq.org EOE/AA.

Apply online: https://us241.dayforcehcm.com/CandidatePortal/en-US/ccbq/Posting/View/22131

title: Fast Food - Multi-Unit Store Manager
description:
***Are you passionate about bubble tea businesses?***

***Are you someone who always thrives to grow and accomplish more?***

***If yes, join us today!***

***If not now, when?***

***If not me, who?***

Founded in Toronto, Real Fruit Bubble Tea has been committed to making fresh fruit drinks healthy and accessible for anyone to enjoy since 2002. We have 128 locations across Canada and USA. As a rapidly expanding business, we want you to join our team and grow with us, and we can build you up from store manager to regional manager and beyond! **There is huge potential for growth, and we welcome anyone who is up to a challenging yet rewarding journey!**

**Position Description**

Reporting to the Regional Manager and above, the Muti-Unit Store Manager is responsible for supervising and overseeing the sales performance of the stores and ensuring the proper shift assignment for staffs that work at the store. They are also responsible for fostering an inclusive, passionate, energetic, and welcoming retail environment and help co-workers to constantly grow and improve.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

· Maintain frequent and uninterrupted communication with the Regional Manager and ensure that the company's regulatory and operational policies and guidelines of the store are followed.

· Propose and establish an achievable sales goal for the store, and to encourage, inspire and propel the co-workers to work collectively to accomplish it.

· Ensure that all co-workers comply with the company's operating standards, and store's policies regarding food safety and sanitation regulations are strictly followed and applied.

· Train, supervise and discipline all partners on procedures and provide ongoing feedback for improvement.

· Foster a welcoming and energetic environment that embodies that philosophy of Real Fruit Bubble Tea’s visions and belief.

· Demonstrate exceptional guest service and superior follow-up skills with customers or potential customers.

· Assist in store operations by preparing ingredients, maintaining inventory levels, ensuring cleanliness, and any ad hoc tasks.

· Ensure that all partners are operating safely and in compliance with Occupational Health and Safety Act (OHSA) and employment standards.

**Expectation of Successful Candidate**

· 3+ years of store manager experiences, or 5+ years of working experiences within the food industry

· Language proficiency in English, with strong oral and written communication skills

· Strong leadership and interpersonal skills

· Strong multitasking skills and ability to perform tasks effectively under pressure

· Exceptional customer service skills and demonstrate strong communication

· High level of organizational capabilities

· Ability to implement RFBT's policies and procedures effectively

En Everneat, tenemos la misión de ayudar a las personas a sentirse renovadas y reenfocadas en su propio espacio a través de una experiencia de limpieza profesional natural y de bajo desperdicio.

¿Te gusta tener un impacto positivo en la vida de otras personas con tus habilidades de limpieza? ¡Queremos trabajar contigo!

¿Te encantan los productos naturales y estás de acuerdo en que es posible reducir los residuos de plástico/papel y agua? ¡Queremos trabajar contigo!

¿Acepta nuevos desafíos y cree que el trabajo en equipo es clave para el éxito? ¡Queremos trabajar contigo!

Si eres tú, ¡queremos conocerte mejor!

Nuestro puesto de empleado de limpieza residencial (W-2) ofrece entre 20 y 40 horas por semana, de lunes a domingo de 8 a. m. a 5 a 6 p. m. (elige tus días libres).

\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_

At Everneat, we’re on the mission of helping people feel refreshed and refocused in their own space through a natural and low-waste professional cleaning experience.

Do you enjoy making a positive impact in other people’s lives with your cleaning skills? We want to work with you!

Do you love natural products and agree that reducing plastic/paper waste and water is possible? We want to work with you!

Do you embrace new challenges and believe that team work is they key to success? We want to work with you!

If this is you, we want to know you better!

Our Residential Cleaning Employee Position (W-2) offers between 20-40hrs per week, Monday- Sunday from 8am to 5~6pm (choose your days off).

title: Fast Food - Regional Manager
description:
***Are you passionate about bubble tea businesses?***  
***Are you someone who always thrives to grow and accomplish more?***  
***If yes, join us today!***  
***If not now, when?***  
***If not me, who?***

Founded in Toronto, Real Fruit Bubble Tea has been committed to making fresh fruit drinks healthy and accessible for anyone to enjoy since 2002. We have **129 locations** across Canada and USA. As a rapidly expanding business, we want you to join our team and grow with us, and we can build you up from regional manager to operations and beyond! **There is huge potential for growth, and we welcome anyone who is up to a challenging yet rewarding journey!**

**Position Description**

Reporting to the Operations Manager and above, the Regional Manager will be in charge of the region or district operating in the day-to-day responsibilities with regards to operations, sales, food and labor and other aspect of the business as the direct report instructs.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

* **This position requires a lot of travel.**  **Perform work in store is a must.**
* Maintain frequent and uninterrupted communication with the Operation Manager, and ensure that daily operational guidelines of the multi-locations are followed.
* Measure and provide counsel on improving operational performances.
* Supervise regular management performance of multi-locations and evaluate them routinely for growth and improvement.
* Train, supervise and discipline co-workers of multi-locations on procedures and provide ongoing feedback for improvement.
* Help develop policies and procedures to ensure the achievement of goals, including but not limited to excellence of customer services, facility cleanliness, and maintenance of daily practice.
* Ensure that operational and training standards of multi-locations are consistently enforced and executed by co-workers.
* Direct sales and marketing for all regional stores, while assisting in the design, development and application of aggressive marketing and sales strategies.

**Expectation of Successful Candidate**

* 5+ years of Regional Manager experiences within QSR food industries
* Language proficiency in English, with strong oral and written communication skills
* Strong leadership and interpersonal skills
* Strong presentation and analytical skills
* Hands-on experience in providing front-line support
* Strong multi-tasking skills and ability to perform tasks effectively under pressure
* Exceptional customer service skills and demonstrate strong communication and high level of organizational capabilities
* Ability to implement RFBT's policies and procedures effectively
* High level of organizational capabilities
* Ability and willingness to travel and support RFBT stores within the Region
* Ability to perform all frontline store duties
* Language proficiency in Cantonese/Mandarin/Spanish an asset

**Perks and Benefits**

* Paid Time Off
* Advancement Opportunities
* Ongoing training & career development
* Discounted Drinks
* Competitive Salary
* Company Events
* Other benefits

Pay: $90,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

* 8 hour shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

title: Press Brake Operator
description:
Job Summary:  
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Press Brake Operator to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for operating press brakes to bend and shape sheet metal into precise forms. The successful candidate will possess strong mechanical knowledge and a keen eye for detail, ensuring high-quality production and adherence to precise specifications.

Responsibilities:

- Operate press brakes to bend and shape sheet metal according to design specifications and tolerances.  
- Use hand tools, calipers, and micrometers to measure and verify the accuracy of sheet metal parts.  
- Perform laser cutting and welding tasks as required, demonstrating a solid understanding of safety protocols and machine operations.  
- Work effectively with other team members to ensure efficient production and maintain a clean and organized workshop environment.  
- Troubleshoot and resolve any issues that may arise during production, utilizing mechanical knowledge and problem-solving skills.  
- Apply GD&T principles to ensure precise measurement and accuracy in the production process.  
- Perform routine maintenance tasks to ensure the proper functioning of press brakes and other equipment.  
- Collaborate with designers and engineers to ensure that production meets design specifications and quality standards.  
- Maintain accurate records of production and quality control processes.

Skills:

- Strong mechanical knowledge and experience working with sheet metal and metal fabrication.  
- Proficiency in using hand tools and calipers for measurement and verification.  
- Familiarity with laser cutting and welding processes.  
- Experience operating a stamping press and performing related tasks.  
- In-depth understanding of GD&T principles and their application in manufacturing.  
- Solid machining skills, including the ability to read blueprints and operate CNC machines.  
- Expertise in using micrometers for precise measurement and verification.  
- Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot and resolve production issues.  
- Excellent attention to detail and a commitment to quality and safety.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $22.27 - $23.19 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Manufacturing: 4 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Wayne, NJ 07470 (Required)

HouseCalls Home Care is currently seeking a motivated, caring, and compassionate **Patient Care Coordinator** to join our team in our Brooklyn office. Our goal is to provide superior, compassionate home care workers and healthcare services for elderly and disabled individuals in the comfort and dignity of their homes.

You will be responsible for consulting with patients and determining their needs, developing care plans, coordinating patient-care services, educating them about their condition, and working with the care team to evaluate interventions.

The successful applicant will display a compassionate nature, be knowledgeable about health care practices, and provide exceptional customer service

* At least 3 years of experience in care coordination or clinical practices.
* Good verbal and written communication skills.
* Computer skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office.
* Strong analytical thinking and the ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently.
* Excellent customer service.
* Compassion and empathy.

* Reports to the patient care coordinator manager
* Consult with patients and family members to discuss their health problems.
* Educate patients about their condition, medication, and give them specific instructions.
* Develop a care plan to address their personal health care needs.
* Consult and collaborate with other health care providers and specialists to set up patient appointments and treatment plans.
* Check in on the patient regularly and evaluate and document their progress.
* Assist the care team with developing and assessing health interventions.
* Attend ongoing training and courses to keep abreast of new developments in health care.

General Sales Manager
description:
The Manager in Training will be responsible for hiring, developing and performance managing a sales force that is focused on the guest experience, driving sales to deliver their budget and increase repeat business. By focusing on their team members “Why”, fostering positive belief systems, and coaching on process behaviors, the leader will achieve their store’s KPI’s and help each team member do the same. The Manager in Training must maintain laser focus by being in Position to Impact on the sales floor.

Essential Functions

· Lead the team by focusing on FDE’s 7 critical sales leadership processes:

1) Manage and Monitor Staffing

2) Onboard New Team Members

3) Engage, Develop and Performance Manage Team Members

4) Manage and Execute FDE’s Proven Sales Process

5) Manage Prospecting and Follow Up

6) Manage Quality and Compliance

7) Position to Impact

· Demonstrate mastery of FDE’s Leadership Toolkit.

· Attend training sessions such as Managers Meetings, Product and Vendor Training, Leadership Training and Managers Essentials to improve abilities as required.

· Coach and develop other leaders such as Assistant Selling Managers and Coaches.

· Set the tone for the day by leading and participating in “Peak State” huddles and scrimmages.

· Focus on essential sales KPI’s:

o Achieve Store Sales Budget

o Staff to Traffic/Turnover

o Sales Per Guest

o Sleep %

o Protection %

o Accessories %

o Close Rate

o Average Sale

o Net Margin

o Split %

o Net Promoter Score (NPS)

o Appointment % Booked of Unsold Guests

o Total Piece Exception Rate

· Ensure the sales functions support the company’s mission and values.

· Attend and facilitate the “Perfect Store Visit” meeting weekly.

· Make certain the showroom floor is guest ready at all times.

· Take Team Opportunities (T/O’s) and overflow guests to train team members and keep personal sales process skills sharp.

Schedule Expectations

· Scheduled to work a minimum of 45 hours per week including Saturdays and Sundays; the number of hours worked will increase during holidays or blackout periods, for vacation coverage, or for other business needs.

· Scheduled for two days off each week, except during holidays or blackout periods.

· Regular attendance at the assigned store in accordance with these schedule expectations is an essential function of the job and all job functions are performed at designated job location.

Education & Experience Requirements

· High school diploma or GED. Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree preferred.

· Must demonstrate ability to work in a fast pace environment that reflect the business needs of the company.

· Strong ability to get results through others by effective goal setting and performance measurement.

· Strong leadership, coaching, interpersonal and communication skills

· Ability to empower and develop a team and hold them accountable

· Ability to build solid work relationships and teamwork throughout an organization

· Highly organized and ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities

· Strong MS Office skills (Word, Excel, Power Point), and the ability to easily learn Ashley’s internal computer systems

title: FLSD-Hotel Security Officer
description:
A Base Officer for The Roxy Hotel has excellent communication and guest service skills, along with the responsibility of protecting the life and safety of all hotel occupants, protecting the physical premises, guest and team member property, as well as the business assets and reputation of the company. A hotel Base Officer at must possess a valid security guard license in the state of New York, an FDNY-issued Fire & Life Safety Director certificate of fitness, and certification in the use of emergency life-saving measures: CPR, use of an Automated External Defibrillator, and First Aid. Base Officers must be prepared to respond to a wide range of emergency situations while exercising competence, professionalism, responsibility, maturity, and hospitality. A Base Officer possesses excellent written and verbal communication skills, and is proficient with standard office technology and equipment. A Base Officer is attentive to detail, diligent to following established policies and procedures, accountable to follow-up and follow-through until a task is complete, and provides a professional customer service experience to all hotel guests and patrons. A Base Officer conducts effective recordkeeping and access control measures. A Base Officer assists as needed in resolving guest incidents and concerns. A Base Officer understands the importance of communication and communicates mission-critical information in a timely and effective manner. To be a successful Base Officer, you must have a neat appearance and an engaging, friendly personality.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITES

* Respond to, investigate and report all security incidents
* Monitor CCTV surveillance for suspicious or concerning activity
* Document reports concerning security incidents; obtain physical evidence and supporting information
* Communicate emergency situations and safety hazards to management
* Conduct/assist with evacuation measures during an emergency
* Request and coordinate emergency medical services when needed
* Perform first aid for guest and team member injuries
* Conduct and document routine fire and life safety tests and inspections
* Patrol building premises and monitor security & life safety systems
* Conduct physical access control and visitor identification/verification
* Conduct team member key fob and RFID access card control
* Issue and document issuance of team member keys, radios, equipment, paychecks, and MetroCards.
* Manage package/parcel deliveries and lost and found
* Provide professional customer service to hotel guests and patrons
* Handle and respond to telephone and email inquiries
* Conduct necessary maintenance of door locks and guest room safes
* Assist with VIP security and privacy, event security, and contractor access-control needs and functions

REQUIREMENTS

* **Flexible schedule, with the ability to work Overnights, on weekends, holidays, and all shifts as needed (required**)
* Valid New York State Security Guard License (required upon hire)
* FDNY Fire & Life Safety Director Certification (F89, T89, or F85 – required upon hire)
* CPR/AED/First Aid certification (required or attained at hire)
* At least 6 months of experience in hospitality, housing, or facility security
* Excellent written and verbal command of English language
* Excellent customer service skills
* Computer literate, proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and standard office technology and equipment
* Experience with Micros Opera and/or ALICE a plus
* Experience with Saflok, Vingcard, MS-Shift, Win-Pak systems a plus
* FDNY City Wide Fire Guard (F01) Certification a plus
* FDNY Sprinkler/Standpipe Inspection (S12/S13) Certification a plus
* FDNY Supervision of Fire Panel (S95) Certification a plus
* FDNY Public Assembly Safety Personnel (F03) Certification plus
* FDNY Fire Drill Conductor (F07) Certification a plus

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $25.70 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

title: Registered Dietitian
description:
Job Overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled and dedicated Dietitian to join our team. As a Dietitian, you will be responsible for providing expert nutrition advice and support to patients. Your role will involve developing personalized diets tailored to each patient's unique health requirements. The successful candidate will be passionate about helping patients achieve optimal health through informed nutrition choices.

Responsibilities:

- Conduct diagnostic evaluations to assess patients' nutritional needs and health status.  
- Develop and implement personalized diets and nutrition plans based on patients' physiological knowledge and health coaching.  
- Collaborate with healthcare professionals to provide comprehensive care and support.  
- Perform patient assessments to identify nutritional deficiencies and develop strategies for improvement.  
- Educate patients on the importance of a balanced diet and provide guidance on healthy eating habits.  
- Monitor patients' progress and adjust nutrition plans as needed.  
- Maintain accurate and detailed records of patient care and treatment plans.  
- Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in dietetics and nutrition research.

Skills:

- Strong understanding of dietetics and physiology knowledge.  
- Ability to perform diagnostic evaluations and patient assessments.  
- Experience in health coaching and nutrition planning.  
- Familiarity with tube feeding procedures and techniques.  
- Proficiency in creating personalized diets and nutrition plans based on patients' unique health requirements.  
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  
- Ability to work effectively in a team environment.  
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  
- Commitment to staying current with the latest developments in dietetics and nutrition research.

Come join our family here at Schervier!!!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $38.46 - $48.01 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

License/Certification:

* Registered Dietitian (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Bronx, NY 10463 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Bronx, NY 10463: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Teaching Assistant - Special Education
description:
Lorge is a special needs school with 96 students, age 5 - 21, with emotional and learning disabilities. We have a full time position available September 2022. The Teacher Assistant works under the direction of the Classroom Teacher's supervision to provide students with additional instruction.

Duties and Responsibilities include:

Reinforce lessons presented by the teacher by reviewing material with students one-on-one or in small groups.

Assist in planning and collectively working with the classroom teacher as it relates to curriculum, trips, small groups.

Assist students in understanding the material presented and adapting the information to their learning style.

Develop a familiarity and understanding with the Students' IEP and BIP.

Enforce school and class rules to help teach students proper behavior.

Assist the teacher with record keeping, such as daily attendance tracking, behavioral data and calls to the home.

Facilitate and monitor the Google Stream, Classroom, Max Scholar, Prodigy, Alma and all internal based internet applications.

Provide daily feedback to teachers and other necessary personnel as to student progress.

-Assist in maintaining and enforcing a positive school climate and classroom culture

-the ability to work well with students with emotional and behavioral disabilities.

-Effective communication, written, interpersonal, organizational skills and the ability to work as a team player.

**Credentials/Qualifications:**

Candidates must possess a New York State Teacher Assistant certification and must be fingerprint eligible in the NYC Department of Education Pupil Tracking system.

Bachelor's Degree and previous experience as a teaching assistant.

Candidates must be proficient in the use of technology have equipment necessary to participate in virtual learning, such as a laptop, wifi capability, if necessary.

title: Project Manager
description:
**Who we are:**

Fello is a dynamic and rapidly growing Tech Rental company with a passionate team dedicated to providing products and services to thousands of events nationwide.

We are seeking a motivated Project Manager to join our team. This role is essential for ensuring that projects are completed seamlessly and on time. The Project manager will work closely with team members, vendors, and clients to drive projects to successful completion.

The Project Manager is a full time position and reports directly to the Chief Operating Officer.

**Key Responsibilities**

Project Planning and Management:

* Define project scope, goals, and deliverables.
* Develop detailed project plans, timelines, and schedules.
* Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects.
* Ensure resource availability and allocation.
* Monitor and track project progress, ensuring projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget.

Team Coordination:

* Lead and motivate project teams, ensuring collaboration and effective communication.
* Assign tasks and responsibilities to team members.
* Identify and resolve issues and conflicts within the project team.

Stakeholder Management:

* Act as the main point of contact for all project-related matters.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, vendors, and internal stakeholders.
* Provide regular project updates to stakeholders, including status reports and risk assessments.

Quality Assurance:

* Ensure project deliverables meet quality standards and client expectations.
* Implement and manage project changes to achieve project outputs.

Documentation and Reporting:

* Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation.
* Report and escalate issues to management as needed.

**Qualifications:** 

* Proven experience as a Project Manager in a similar role.
* Strong understanding of project management methodologies and best practices.
* Excellent organizational and multitasking skills.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in project management software/tools.
* Ability to lead and motivate a team.
* Problem-solving skills and a proactive approach.
* Experience in creating and managing project budgets.
* Highly tech-savvy with an ability to identify and quickly master new software systems and automations

**What We Offer:** 

* Compensation package of $80,000 - $130,000, commensurate with experience.
* Comprehensive benefits package, including: Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance and 401(k).
* A supportive and collaborative work environment.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* The chance to make a significant impact in a growing company.

Interested candidates should email melisa@fello.com.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: $80,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year

title: Art Teacher
description:
**Job Overview**  
This part-time teaching position starts in mid September.

Classes meets once a week for an 8 week run in your assigned schools.

Must have your own transportation to be hired.

Instructors must be available to teach between Monday-Friday from 3:15pm-5:15pm.

Are you passionate about art and inspiring young artists? Join our team at Jimmy Potters Workshop this Fall!

We are looking for part-time instructors who love art, early childhood development, and teaching creativity to children.

Whether you're an experienced art teacher, a creative parent, or a college student with a love for art, we welcome you to share your passion for pottery in our exciting "Pottery Around the World" classes for 1st-6th graders.

**Duties:**

-Arriving 20 mins early before class starts.  
-Setting up the class for before each class starts.

-Providing guidance and step-by-step instructions and techniques to students

-Encouraging creativity, creating a positive environment and artistic expression among students.

-Keeping all students safe within the full duration of your class

-Cleaning up your designated room properly after each session.

**Requirements:**

1. Education: A background in art, ceramics, or a related field is typically required. A degree in art education or a relevant discipline can be beneficial.

2. Experience: Prior experience working with children, teaching art, or instructing pottery classes is often preferred.

3. Creativity: The ability to come up with engaging and age-appropriate pottery projects that inspire creativity in elementary-aged children.

4. Patience and Communication Skills: Patience is key when working with young children, as well as the ability to communicate effectively and positively with students and parents.

5. Safety Consciousness: Understanding of proper safety protocols when working with pottery materials and tools to ensure the well-being of the students.

6. Organizational Skills: Ability to plan and prepare lessons, set up the studio, and manage materials in an organized manner.

7. Flexibility: Being able to adapt to the needs of individual students and adjust teaching methods as necessary.

8. Enthusiasm for Teaching: A genuine interest in teaching and nurturing the artistic growth of children.

9. Continuous Learning: Willingness to stay updated on new pottery techniques, teaching methods, and child development practices to enhance your skills as an instructor.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $50.00 - $55.00 per hour

Schedule:

description:
Social Media Producer

**About Us:**  
Bad Behavior is a dynamic short-form content studio and creative agency specializing in crafting engaging, high-impact content for brands across various industries, including beauty, sports, fashion, food, music, finance, and more. We are a team of creative professionals passionate about storytelling and pushing the boundaries of digital content, particularly on platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube.

**Position Overview:**  
We are seeking an experienced and highly organized Social Media Producer to join our team. As a Social Media Producer, you will play a crucial role in the planning, production, and execution of compelling short-form content across numerous projects. . This role requires a detail-oriented individual with strong project management skills, a creative mindset, and a deep understanding of social media trends and platforms.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Content Production Management:** Oversee the entire production process of short-form content, from pre-production planning to post-production, ensuring high-quality deliverables that meet the brand's vision and objectives.
* **Organize Shoots:** Coordinate and manage all aspects of content shoots, including location scouting, scheduling, equipment rentals, and logistics.
* **Personnel Management:** Assemble and manage a team of creatives, including videographers, photographers, editors, and other freelancers, ensuring smooth and efficient collaboration.
* **Talent Coordination:** Work closely with influencers, talent, and on-screen personalities, handling contracts, negotiations, and on-set management to ensure alignment with the brand’s voice and objectives.
* **Post-Production Oversight:** Supervise post-production processes, including editing, sound design, graphics, and color correction, to ensure content is polished and ready for distribution.
* **Creative Collaboration:** Collaborate with the creative team to develop content ideas, scripts, and storyboards that align with brand guidelines and current social media trends.
* **Budget Management:** Manage project budgets, ensuring all production activities are completed within financial constraints while maintaining high-quality standards.
* **Client Communication:** Serve as the primary point of contact for clients during the production process, ensuring clear communication, managing expectations, and delivering on project goals.
* **Trend Analysis:** Stay updated on the latest trends, tools, and best practices in social media content production, bringing fresh and innovative ideas to the table.
* **Quality Control:** Conduct quality checks on all content before it is published, ensuring consistency with brand standards and messaging.

**Requirements:**

* 3+ years of experience in social media production, digital content creation, or a related field.
* Strong project management and organizational skills, with the ability to multitask and handle multiple projects simultaneously.
* Deep understanding of social media platforms (TikTok, Instagram Reels, YouTube, etc.) and what makes content perform well on each.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience working with talent, clients, and creative teams.
* Proficiency in video production and post-production tools (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, After Effects).
* Creative thinker with a keen eye for detail and a passion for storytelling.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities.
* Familiarity with budgeting, scheduling, and other aspects of production management.
* Knowledge of influencer marketing and digital advertising is a plus.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $72,000.00 - $86,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Adobe Premiere: 1 year (Required)
* Organizational skills: 2 years (Required)
* Video production: 3 years (Required)

title: Accounts Receivable Analyst
description:

title: Director, Commerce & Retail Media
description:
**Company Description**  

iProspect is a global, award-winning agency – focused on converting consumer intent into action and driving business performance for some of the world’s largest brands. For brands to win, they must understand consumers' intent and harness the best digital platforms and systems to not only engage but convert them. iProspect excels in finding the sweet spot between brands and people. Information and choices. Intentions and data. It's our specialty.

 **Job Description** *This is a remote opportunity, open to anyone within the US.*

  

Reporting to the SVP of Retail Media, the Commerce & Retail Media team at dentsu leads strategy, activation and optimizations for large buy-side Retail Media brands (CPG, Apparel, Electronics, etc.). The Director will be a team leader and be a subject matter expert to guide the team in strategy, performance optimization, and reporting for campaigns within Amazon, Criteo, Instacart, Walmart and other retail media networks. You will play an essential role on client teams to build strategy with your teams and steer them to build and execute large-scale campaigns and tests that deliver on our strategy for the client. You will guide our teams in delivering reporting, insights and projects promptly and within budget plans.


You Will:

* Manage other members of the team and help in ongoing optimization efforts to meet campaign goals, including daily management of campaign budgets, bid management, reporting, keyword and targeting strategies, and campaign revisions based on performance history and our client's goals.
* Help the team plan and implement retail media campaigns, including account setup, campaign builds, daily optimization, bid strategy development and managed and budget pacing.
* Use the latest technology and best practice to build strategic automation into campaign management and reporting.
* Work with our reporting teams and tech to develop and update performance reports to provide actionable insights and analysis
* Ensure campaigns are run to agreed upon best practice guidelines. Augmenting and refreshing those best practices within the team and the larger department as retail media capabilities progress.
* Assist and attend regularly scheduled client performance and status meetings along with ad-hoc presentations/requests.
* Develop strong partnerships with our clients, our internal client team leaders and retail media network partners.
* Collaborate across our client team and within the commerce & retail media organization to solve, build skills and develop expertise and best practices
* Enthusiasm for performance marketing, new platforms and the exciting world of eCommerce and emerging platforms.

  

**Qualifications**  

* At least 6 years digital performance marketing experience in ecommerce / retail search, paid search, PPC, paid social, programmatic, or related field or 4+ years managing large-scale, complex ecommerce campaigns. You should have a experience and enjoy developing talent and serving as a career advocate for your team members.
* Experience managing budgets, meeting KPIs and informing KPI goals
* Experience fostering client relationships and guiding the agency to lead incremental value for its partner(s)
* SaaS platform (i.e. PacVue, Skai, Commerce IQ, etc.) and bid management platform experience required
* CPG experience is preferred, but not required
* E-Commerce MarTech experience (PIMs, DAMs, ERP) preferred, not required
* Excel skills (can perform complex functions), with the ability to identify insights through data analysis
* Experience working in the rapidly evolving world of Commerce & Retail Media

  

**Additional Information**  

The anticipated base salary range for this position is $94,000-$152,375. Salary is based on a variety of factors, including relevant experience, knowledge, skills and other factors permitted by law Additionally, this position is eligible for discretionary incentive compensation. The company's incentive compensation plan is subject to change. A range of medical, dental, vision, 401(k) matching, paid time off, and/o r other benefits also are available. For more information regarding dentsu benefits, please visit www.dentsubenefitsplus.com.


#LI-AD2

Dentsu is an integrated growth and transformation partner to the world’s leading organizations. Founded in 1901 in Tokyo, Japan, and now present in more than 110 markets, it has a proven track record of nurturing and developing innovations, combining the talents of its global network of leadership brands to develop impactful and integrated growth solutions for clients. Dentsu delivers end-to-end experience transformation (EX) by integrating its services across Media, CXM and Creative, while its business transformation (BX) mindset pushes the boundaries of transformation and sustainable growth for brands, people and society.


Dentsu, Innovating to Impact.

title: PHARMACY SPECIALIST
description:
JOB PURPOSE:
The Pharmacy Specialist should have a good understanding of Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) federal regulations and New York State Medicaid regulations related to the pharmacy benefit. The individual will assist with the required delegated oversight and monitoring (OM) functions for the CenterLight PACE program. The OM function has financial implications for the detection of claims processing issues and has a direct impact if a participant is unable to obtain their medications under the required guidelines. The Pharmacy Specialist is a vital part of the pharmacy team, and coordinates care for our participants to ensure medication access.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:* Review daily rejected claim report.
* Contact providers/pharmacies informing formulary alternatives when available and/or how to submit Prior Authorization requests and follow up on the cases when necessary.
* Assist dispensing pharmacies with claim issues.
* Analysis and identify inappropriately paid and denied claims that have financial implications both for the pharmacy budget and prevention of financial actions from CMS.
* Act as pharmacy liaison between the clinical pharmacy department and other internal departments. Answer or re-direct internal and external questions related to pharmacy; provide supportive research and analysis as needed and follow through to resolution.
* Review transition fill a report to ensure transition fills are appropriate and assist provider with formulary alternative switch.
* Generate and distribute reports to the Pharmacy Management team and other programs as needed. Upload PBM reports to the Pharmacy SharePoint sites and keeps the document organized and complete.
* Provide support to the pharmacy team on different clinical programs, which includes care coordination with pharmacy/providers, record keeping/tracking, and reporting.
* Perform additional functions as needed for the operations of the Pharmacy department.


Weekly Hours: 40
Schedule: 8:30 AM - 5:30 PM
QUALIFICATIONS:
Education:* High School Diploma or equivalent required; Pharmacy Technician Certification is preferred; Bachelor’s degree preferred but not required


Experience* 2-5 years of Retail Pharmacy, Health Plan, and/ or PBM (pharmacy benefit manager) experience preferred. Demonstrates knowledge in the field of pharmacy.
* Expert level proficiency with Microsoft applications, including use of Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Able to create reports and manipulate data sets.
* Self-motivated, with demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
* Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing.
* High level of integrity as demonstrated by 1) appropriate treatment of confidential information, 2) adherence to policies, procedures, rules, and regulations, 3) professional conduct in dealing with persons internal and external to the organization, and 4) sensitivity towards target population.
* Multi-lingual a plus.


Other:* Follow all applicable government regulations including HIPAA.
* Performs other related duties as required.
* Relates to and communicates effectively with staff, participants, and families.
* Incorporates a customer service approach to problem-solving and all operations.
* Adheres to all Human Resources (HR) and Staff Development policies and procedures, including facility and department orientation and mandatory training and education.


Physical Requirements
Individuals must be able to sustain certain physical requirements essential to the job. This includes, but is not limited to:* Standing – Duration of up to 6 hours a day.
* Sitting/Stationary Positions – Sedentary position in duration of up to 6-8 hours a day for consecutive hours/periods.
* Lifting/Push/Pull – Up to 50 pounds of equipment, baggage, supplies, and other items used in the scope of the job using OSHA guidelines, etc.
* Bending/Squatting – Have to be able to safely bend or squat to perform the essential functions under the scope of the job.
* Stairs/Steps/Walking/Climbing – Must be able to safely maneuver stairs, climb up/down, and walk to access work areas.
* Agility/Fine Motor Skills - Must demonstrate agility and fine motor skills to operate and activate equipment, devices, instruments, and tools to complete essential job functions (ie. typing, use of supplies, equipment, etc.)
* Sight/Visual Requirements – Must be able to visually read documentation, papers, orders, signs, etc., and type/write documentation, etc. with accuracy.
* Audio Hearing and Motor Skills (Language) Requirements – Must be able to listen attentively and document information from patients, community members, co-workers, clients, providers, etc., and intake information through audio processing with accuracy. In addition, they must be able to speak comfortably and clearly with language motor skills for customers to understand the individual.
* Cognitive Ability – Must be able to demonstrate good decision-making, reasonableness, cognitive ability, rational processing, and analysis to satisfy essential functions of the job.
